periclymenos: <entryFree id="n35042" type="greek" key="pe^ri_^cly^me^nos" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrī^clymĕnos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">periklu/menos</foreign>, <sense id="n35042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a climbing plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the woodbine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">honeysuckle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> clymenus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 94, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
periclymenus: <entryFree id="n35043" type="main" key="Pe^ri_^cly^me^nus" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrī^clymĕnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*periklu/menos</foreign>, <sense id="n35043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Neleus and brother of Nestor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Argonauts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who had received from Neptune the power of changing his shape at pleasure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 556</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pericope: <entryFree id="n35044" type="greek" key="pe^ri^co^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭcŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perikoph/</foreign>, <sense id="n35044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a section</hi> of a book, etc. (eccl. Lat.), Hier. in Joel, 2,</sense></entryFree>
periculor: <entryFree id="n35045" type="main" key="pe^ri_cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrīcŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>periculum</etym>, i. q. periclitor, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
periculose: <entryFree id="n35046" type="main" key="pe^ri_cu^lo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrīcŭlōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. periculosus <sense id="n35046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
periculosus: <entryFree id="n35047" type="main" key="pe^ri_cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrīcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>periculum</etym>, <sense id="n35047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hazardous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perilous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in nosmetipsos periculosi,</quote> <trans><tr>incurring danger</tr>, <tr>endangering ourselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculosum et grave bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculosum et infestum iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1</bibl></cit>. 24, 83.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo Romano periculosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta periculoso, ficta seu vera promeret,</quote> <trans><tr>since it was equally perilous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur. as subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castris quoque periculosa fortissimis imperantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 21</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:17:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrīcŭlōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">dangerously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hazardously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perilously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">risk</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">peril</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">periculose aegrotans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculose dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculose a paucis emi, quod multorum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: nihilo periculosius, <hi rend="ital">without any greater risk</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 64.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: periculosissime aliquid facere, <hi rend="ital">with the greatest danger</hi>, Sen. de Ira, 3, 22, 2.</sense></entryFree>
periculum: <entryFree id="n35048" type="main" key="pe^ri_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrīcŭlum</orth> (contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrīclum</orth>, very freq. in the poets, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 26 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 580</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 709</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">751</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 711</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 94</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root, Sanscr. par, pi-par-mi, to conduct, guide; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pera/w</foreign>, to pierce; <foreign lang="greek">po/ros</foreign>. a way through, passage; Lat. porta, portus, ex - perior, per-itus; cf. Germ. fahren, Gefahr</etym>, <sense id="n35048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essay</hi> (class.; cf. disorimen). </sense><sense id="n35048.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac periculum in litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miser est homo qui amat ... Scio qui periclum feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam periclum faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus fidei periculum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make trial of</tr>, <tr>to try</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā in re tute tui periculum fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: legionum, Auct. B. Afr. 79.— </sense><sense id="n35048.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35048.3" n="A" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">an attempt</hi> in <cb n="PERI" /> writing, <hi rend="ital">an essay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciunt imperite, qui in isto periculo non ut a poëtā, sed ut a teste, veritatem exigent (speaking of a poem in honor of Marius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 215</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35048.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Risk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hazard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peril</hi> (which acompanies an attempt; <cit><quote lang="la">the common signif. of the word): meo periclo rem gero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuo ego istaec dicam illi periculo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to run a risk</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ei subito sit allatum periculum discrimenque patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salus sociorum summum in periculum ac discrimen vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discriminum et periculorum comites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:166" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obire pericula ac labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum adire capitis,</quote> <trans><tr>to run the risk of one's life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in periculo animarum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subire pro amico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 19, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take upon one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 36, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingredi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conflare alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause</tr>, <tr>occasion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intendere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intendere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis alicui inicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 29, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facessere innocenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego nihil facio tibi periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 38, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moliri optimis civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici depellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterfugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adducta est res in maximum periculum et extremum paene discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in periculum capitis atque in vitae discrimen inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcessere aliquem in summum capitis periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">includere in periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:55:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 55, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in periculum se committere,</quote> <trans><tr>to get into danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:8:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripere ex periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrahere ex periculo,</quote> <trans><tr>to release from danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam a periculo prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberare periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in periculo vertitur,</quote> <trans><tr>the affair becomes perilous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in periculo versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a securi negat ei periculum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>that danger threatens him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:44:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 44, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum est, ne,</quote> <trans><tr>there is danger that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 118</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 11, 32</bibl>: periculo meo, tuo, suo, <hi rend="ital">at my</hi>, <hi rend="ital">your</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his risk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 52, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crede audacter meo periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo periculo rem gero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">des ei nummos fide et periculo meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem sumptu periculoque suo armatam mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:20:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 20, § 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem periculi sui facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to do a thing at one's own risk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:5:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: bono periculo, <hi rend="ital">safely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without danger</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 320, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35048.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35048.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suit at law</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meus labor in privatorum periculis caste integreque versatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in periculis defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35048.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A writ of judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sentence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum ab iis petivit, ut in periculo suo inscriberent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,015:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ep. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:79:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 79, § 183</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35048.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A sickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack of sickness</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in acutis vero periculis nullis dandum est vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35048.9" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">tremefactae nutant usque ad periculum civitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peridoneus: <entryFree id="n35049" type="main" key="pe^ri^do_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ĭdōnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very well adapted to</hi> any thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n35049.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus peridoneus castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2</bibl></cit>. 24: <cit><quote lang="la">visus est peridoneus praeceptor, maxime ad poëticam tendentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35049.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: gens ad furta belli peridonea, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 310, 15</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 515</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35049.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">qui</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peridoneus maritus matri, cui bono periculo totam domus fortunam concrederet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
periegesis: <entryFree id="n35050" type="main" key="Pe^ri^e_ge_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭēgēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perih/ghsis</foreign>, <sense id="n35050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leading round</hi> to exhibit whatever is worth notice; hence, <hi rend="ital">a geographical description.</hi> This term is used as <hi rend="ital">the title of a poem by Avienus.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭēgētĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the writer of travels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metrodorus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> ad Stat. Th. 3, 479</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perileucos: <entryFree id="n35051" type="greek" key="pe^ri^leucos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭleucos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/leukos</foreign> (white all round), <sense id="n35051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 180</bibl>. <cb n="PERI" /></sense></entryFree>
perilla: <entryFree id="n35052" type="main" key="Pe^rilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 437</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 279, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perillus: <entryFree id="n35053" type="main" key="Pe^rillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pe/rillos</foreign>, <sense id="n35053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Athenian worker in metal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who made a brazen bull for the tyrant Phalaris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which criminals were to be enclosed and roasted to death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was the first that suffered in this manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 653</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:212" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 89</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35053.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrillēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Perillus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Perillean</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:439" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 439</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perillustris: <entryFree id="n35054" type="main" key="pe^rillustris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-illustris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n35054.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very brilliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very notable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sub ipsā proscriptione perillustre fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35054.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Greatly distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">highly honored</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perimachia: <entryFree id="n35055" type="greek" key="pe^ri^ma^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭmăchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perimaxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n35055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile assault</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perimbecillus: <entryFree id="n35056" type="main" key="pe^rimbe^cillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-imbĕcillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very weak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum anserum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quidem est natum perimbecillum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perimedeus: <entryFree id="n35057" type="main" key="Pe^ri^me_de_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭmēdēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sorceress Perimede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Perimedean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magical</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">gramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit> (18).</sense></entryFree>
perimele: <entryFree id="n35058" type="main" key="Pe^ri^me_le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭmēlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Hippodamas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was changed into the island of the same name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 590</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perimetros: <entryFree id="n35059" type="greek" key="pe^ri^me^tros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭmĕtros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/metros</foreign>, <sense id="n35059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circumference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perimeter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 26" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:40" default="NO">40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perimo: <entryFree id="n35060" type="main" key="pe^ri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭmo</orth> (orig. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕmo</orth>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=217" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 217</bibl> Müll.), ēmi, emptum (emtum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>per-emo</etym>, <sense id="n35060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take away entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to annihilate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extinguish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy; to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35060.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: perdo, deleo): penitus materiem omnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensu perempto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: luna subito perempta est, <hi rend="ital">was taken away</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">vanished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappeared</hi>, id. poët. Div. 1, 11, 18: <cit><quote lang="la">divum simulacra peremit fulminis ardor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troja perempta,</quote> <trans><tr>destroyed</tr>, <tr>ruined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 787</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus macie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 21</bibl>: ne quid consul auspici peremat, <hi rend="ital">should hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=217" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 217</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">reditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi aliqui casus consilium ejus peremisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si causam publicam mea mors peremisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 22, 49</bibl></cit>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 450, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perimit urbem incendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 11, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem (supremus ille dies) perimit ac delet omnino, quid melius, quam? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35060.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trucido): perempta et interempta pro interfectis poni solet a poëtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=217" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 217</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:886" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 886</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudeli morte peremptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem caede,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 110</bibl></cit>: hunc, ubi tam teneros volucres matremque peremit (trans. from Homer), Cic. poët. Div. 2, 30, 64; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 395</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conceptum abortu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 44, 69, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes fratrum indigne peremptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perimpeditus: <entryFree id="n35061" type="main" key="pe^rimpe^di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-impĕdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very much obstructed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very difficult to pass</hi>: locus, Auct. B. Afr. 58.</sense></entryFree>
perimula: <entryFree id="n35062" type="main" key="Pe^ri^mu_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭmūla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perinaeon: <entryFree id="n35063" type="greek" key="pe^ri^naeon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭnaeon</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭnēon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perinaion, perineon</foreign>, <sense id="n35063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space between the sexual parts and the fundament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the perineum</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:66" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:68" default="NO">68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:3:59" default="NO">5, 3, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perincertus: <entryFree id="n35064" type="main" key="pe^rincertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-incertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very uncertain</hi>, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perincommode: <entryFree id="n35065" type="main" key="pe^rincommo^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrincommŏdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perincommodus <sense id="n35065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perincommodus: <entryFree id="n35066" type="main" key="pe^rincommo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-incommŏdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very inconvenient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very troublesome</hi> or <hi rend="ital">annoying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrin-commŏdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very inconveniently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very unfortunately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidit perincommode, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perinconsequens: <entryFree id="n35067" type="main" key="pe^rinconse^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-inconsĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very inconsequent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very absurd</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">per tmesin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perinde: <entryFree id="n35068" type="main" key="pe^rinde"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-inde</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, a particle of comparison. <sense id="n35068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the same manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quite as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equally; in like manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just so</hi> (class.; cf. proinde, with which it is frequently confounded<pb n="1345" /> <cb n="PERI" />  in MSS. and edd.). </sense><sense id="n35068.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendi artem tantam tamque operosam et perinde fructuosam relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si perinde cetera processissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non Pyrrhum, aut Antiochum populo Romano perinde metuendos fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilissimum munus, sed non perinde populare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: Mithridates corpore ingenti, perinde armatus, <hi rend="ital">in a corresponding manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>, Sall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde laudaret castigaretque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35068.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with the conjunctions <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ac</hi>), <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ac si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, etc. (so most freq.) </sense><sense id="n35068.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ac</hi>), <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non perinde atque ego putaram,</quote> <trans><tr>not exactly as I had expected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africam ei perinde ac debellatum in Italiā foret provinciam destinabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 38, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 58, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 21, 3</bibl>: perinde ac satisfacere et fraudata restituere vellent, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35068.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utcumque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:50:188" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 50, 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde sunt ut aguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:56:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 56, 213</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec perinde ut maluisset plebes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde ut afficeretur,</quote> <trans><tr>just as</tr>, <tr>according as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde utcumque temperatus sit aër, ita, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in whatever way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35068.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ac si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego perinde tuebar ac si usus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 49, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde aestimans, ac si usus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35068.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde valebit, quasi armatissimi fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec perinde loquor, quasi debueris aut potueris, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 26, 83</bibl></cit> (but B. and K. read proinde ... quasi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 19, 49</bibl>).—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">prout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just according as</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —（<foreign lang="greek">c</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">tamquam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as much as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just the same as if</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">et</hi> or <hi rend="ital">que</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equally with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the same as</hi> (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">perinde odium pravis et honestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde divina humanaque obtegens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the extent that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habes munus a patre meā quidem sententiā magnum, sed perinde erit ut acceperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Julianus nimius religionis Christianae insectator, perinde tamen, ut cruore abstineret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 16</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so much as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā tamen re perinde motus est, quam responso mathematici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 15</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quam si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the same as if</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum perinde aestimandum, quam si Jovem fefellisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 73</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>) Perinde tamquam si, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 29</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">m</foreign>) Haud perinde—quam, <hi rend="ital">not as well ... as</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35068.7" n="b" level="4"> With ellipsis of the second member of the comparison: <cit><quote lang="la">possessione et usu haud perinde afficiuntur (sc. ac facile expectares),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not so much as one would expect</tr>, <tr>not very much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum et argentum non perinde ac reliqui mortales adpetunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coxendice et femore et crure sinistro non perinde valebat (sc. ac dextro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare adventus ejus non perinde gratus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanis haud perinde celebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 88 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
perindigeo: <entryFree id="n35069" type="main" key="pe^rindi^ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-indĭgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to need very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in great need</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perindigne: <entryFree id="n35070" type="main" key="pe^rindigne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-indignē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perindignus <sense id="n35070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perindignus: <entryFree id="n35071" type="main" key="pe^rindignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-indignus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very unworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very unbecoming</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 4</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrindignē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very indignantly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tulit perindigne actum a senatu, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perindulgens: <entryFree id="n35072" type="main" key="pe^rindulgens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-indulgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very indulgent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very tender</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui perindulgens in patrem, idem acerbe severus in fratrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perineon: <entryFree id="n35073" type="main" key="pe^ri^ne_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭnēon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. perinaeon.</entryFree>
perinfamis: <entryFree id="n35074" type="main" key="pe^rinfa_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-infāmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very infamous</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir amore libertinae perinfamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> denoting on what account, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 136, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perinfirmus: <entryFree id="n35075" type="main" key="pe^rinfirmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-infirmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very weak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis perinfirmus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt enim levia et perinfirma, quae dicebantur a te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
peringeniosus: <entryFree id="n35076" type="main" key="pe^ringe^ni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ingĕnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of good natural abilities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very clever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 92</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PERI" /></sense></entryFree>
peringratus: <entryFree id="n35077" type="main" key="pe^ringra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ingrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very ungrateful</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 98:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 98, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
periniquus: <entryFree id="n35078" type="main" key="pe^ri^ni_quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ĭnīquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n35078.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very unfair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very unjust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare videant, ne sit periniquum et non ferendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35078.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very unwilling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very discontented</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi periniquo patiebar animo, te a me digredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perinjurius: <entryFree id="n35079" type="main" key="pe^rinju_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-injūrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very unjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very wrong</hi> (ante-class.), Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 694</bibl> P.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perinsignis: <entryFree id="n35080" type="main" key="pe^rinsignis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-insignis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very remarkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very conspicuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis pravitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perinsolens: <entryFree id="n35081" type="gloss" key="pe^rinso^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-insŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very unusual</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perinteger: <entryFree id="n35082" type="main" key="pe^rinte^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-intĕger</orth>, <itype>gra, grum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very honest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very virtuous</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perinthus: <entryFree id="n35083" type="main" key="Pe^rinthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrinthus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pe/rinqos</foreign>, <sense id="n35083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards called</hi> Heraclea, the modern <hi rend="ital">Erekli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 30</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35083.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrin-thĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Perinthian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): Menander fecit Andriam, et Perinthiam, <hi rend="ital">the Perinthian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a comedy in which one of the principal characters was a girl from Perinthus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perinundo: <entryFree id="n35084" type="main" key="pe^ri^nundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ĭnundo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overflow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inundate completely</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 1, 267</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perinungo: <entryFree id="n35085" type="main" key="pe^ri^nungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ĭnungo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to anoint all over</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tonsas recentes eodem die perinungunt vino et oleo (al. perungunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perinvisus: <entryFree id="n35086" type="main" key="pe^rinvi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-invīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [invideo], <sense id="n35086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">much hated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very odious</hi>: homo dis ac nobilitati perinvisus, Cic. Cornel. Fragm. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 32, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perinvitus: <entryFree id="n35087" type="main" key="pe^rinvi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-invītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very unwilling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne perinvitus legerem tuas litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 2</bibl></cit> (dub.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 57, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
periocha: <entryFree id="n35088" type="greek" key="Pe^ri^o^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭŏcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perioxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n35088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a summary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compendium</hi>, the title in the MSS. of the epitomes of the books of Livy; the title of a work by Ausonius.</sense></entryFree>
periodeuta: <entryFree id="n35089" type="main" key="pe^ri^o^deuta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭŏdeuta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">periodeuth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that goes about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a visitor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
periodicus: <entryFree id="n35090" type="greek" key="pe^ri^o^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭŏdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">periodiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that returns at stated times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">periodical</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">typi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14:110" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14, 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
periodus: <entryFree id="n35091" type="greek" key="pe^ri^o^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭŏdus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭhŏdus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=217" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 217</bibl> Müll.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/odos</foreign>. <sense id="n35091.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A complete sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a period</hi>: in toto circuitu illo orationis, quem Graeci <foreign lang="greek">peri/odon</foreign>, nos tum ambitum, tum circuitum, tum comprehensionem, aut continuationem, aut circumscriptionem dicimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:204" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 61, 204</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 20, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35091.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The circuit of the four Grecian games</hi> (the Pythian, Isthmian, Nemean, and Olympian): <cit><quote lang="la">in gymnicis certaminibus periodon vicisse dicitur, qui Pythia, Isthmia, Nemea, Olympia vicit, a circumitu eorum spectaculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=217" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 217</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
perior: <entryFree id="n35092" type="main" key="pe^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>īri</itype>, v. peritus.</entryFree>
periosteon: <entryFree id="n35093" type="greek" key="pe^ri^oste^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭostĕon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perio/steon</foreign>, <sense id="n35093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the membrane which surrounds the bone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peripateticus: <entryFree id="n35094" type="greek" key="Pe^ri^pa^te_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭpătētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peripathtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Peripatetic</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Aristotelian</hi>) <hi rend="ital">philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Peripatetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peripatetica secta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭpătētĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of the Peripatetic school</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:18:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 18, 8</bibl>.— Usually in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭpătētĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">philosophers of the Peripatetic</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Aristotelian</hi>) <hi rend="ital">school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Peripatetics</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl>. They were so called because Aristotle delivered his lectures while walking about (<foreign lang="greek">peripatw=n</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
peripetasmata: <entryFree id="n35095" type="greek" key="pe^ri^pe^tasma^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭpĕtasmăta</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peripeta/smata</foreign>, <sense id="n35095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coverings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curtains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hangings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carpets</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: aulaeum, stragulum, tapes): Attalica peripetasmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de peripetasmatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>, § 28.</sense></entryFree>
periphas: <entryFree id="n35096" type="main" key="Pe^ri^phas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭphas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peri/fas</foreign>. <sense id="n35096.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 400</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35096.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the companions of Pyrrhus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 476</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n35096.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Lapithœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 449</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peripheres: <entryFree id="n35097" type="greek" key="pe^ri^phe^re_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭphĕrēs</orth>, <itype>ĕs</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">periferh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moving</hi> <cb n="PERI" /> <hi rend="ital">around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounding</hi> (pure Lat. circumstans), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 958</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peripheria: <entryFree id="n35098" type="greek" key="pe^ri^phe^ri_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭphĕrīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perife/reia</foreign>, <sense id="n35098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circumference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">periphery</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 827</bibl> (pure Lat.: linea circumcurrens).</sense></entryFree>
periphoretus: <entryFree id="n35099" type="greek" key="Pe^ri^pho^re_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭphŏrētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perifo/rhtos</foreign> (carried about), <sense id="n35099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Artemon</hi> (who caused himself to be carried about in a litter), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
periphrasis: <entryFree id="n35100" type="greek" key="pe^riphra^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕriphrăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/frasis</foreign>, <sense id="n35100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circumlocution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">periphrase</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl> (pure Lat.: circuitus eloquendi, ambitus verborum, circumlocutio).</sense></entryFree>
periplus: <entryFree id="n35101" type="greek" key="pe^ri^plus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭplus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/plous</foreign>, <sense id="n35101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sailing round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumnavigation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 48, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peripneumonia: <entryFree id="n35102" type="greek" key="pe^ri^pneumo^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭpneumŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peripneumoni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n35102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pulmonary consumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peripneumonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:25:140" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 25, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:26:142" default="NO">2, 26, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:27:143" default="NO">2, 27, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 1, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭ-pneumŏnĭcus</orth> (in a later corrupt form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭpleumŏnĭcus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 28</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭpleumŏnĭăcus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 4</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">peripneumoniko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to consumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consumptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peripneumonic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:14:93" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 14, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 25, § 41</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 7</bibl>, written as Greek). —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭpneumŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a consumptive person</hi> (usu. in <number>plur.</number>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 68, § 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:108" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 24, 50, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:123" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 7, 63, § 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 38, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peripsema: <entryFree id="n35103" type="greek" key="pe^ripse_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕripsēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/yhma</foreign>, that which comes off a thing in cleaning it, <sense id="n35103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">offscouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peripteros: <entryFree id="n35104" type="greek" key="pe^ripte^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕriptĕros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/pteros</foreign>, <sense id="n35104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">surrounded with a row of columns on the outside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
periratus: <entryFree id="n35105" type="main" key="pe^ri_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-īrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very angry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
periscelis: <entryFree id="n35106" type="greek" key="pe^risce^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕriscĕlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">periskeli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leg-band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anklet</hi>, worn by females: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe periscelidem raptam sibi flentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 56</bibl></cit>; v. Orell. ad h. l.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 31, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tortae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:31:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 31, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
periscelium: <entryFree id="n35107" type="greek" key="pe^risce^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕriscĕlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">periske/lion</foreign>, i. q. periscelis, <sense id="n35107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anklet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perisseuma: <entryFree id="n35108" type="main" key="pe^risseuma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrisseuma</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕritteuma</orth>, <itype>another reading for parapeteuma</itype>, v. h. v.</entryFree>
perissochoregia: <entryFree id="n35109" type="greek" key="pe^risso^cho^re_gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrissŏchŏrēgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perissoxorhgi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n35109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a present over and above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an extra present</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 26, 2.</sense></entryFree>
perissologia: <entryFree id="n35110" type="greek" key="pe^risso^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrissŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perissologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n35110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">redundancy of expression</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 658</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perisson: <entryFree id="n35111" type="greek" key="pe^risson"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrisson</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perisso/n</foreign>, <sense id="n35111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> dorycnion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 179</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peristasis: <entryFree id="n35112" type="greek" key="pe^rista^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕristăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/stasis</foreign>, <sense id="n35112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theme</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 48, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peristereon: <entryFree id="n35113" type="greek" key="pe^riste^re^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕristĕrĕon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕristĕre-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peristerew/n</foreign>, <sense id="n35113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vervain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peristereon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 78, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:105" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9, 59, § 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:160" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peristroma: <entryFree id="n35114" type="greek" key="pe^ristro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕristrōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/strwma</foreign>, <sense id="n35114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carpet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Babylonia peristromata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchyliata peristromata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peristrophe: <entryFree id="n35115" type="greek" key="pe^ristro^phe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕristrŏphē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peristrofh/</foreign>, <sense id="n35115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the turning of an opponent's argument against himself</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 563</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peristylium: <entryFree id="n35116" type="greek" key="pe^risty_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕristȳlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peristu/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n35116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place surrounded with columns on the inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a peristyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:70:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 70, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:71:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 71, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>; cf. peristylum.</sense></entryFree>
peristylum: <entryFree id="n35117" type="greek" key="pe^risty_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕristȳlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/stulon</foreign>, <sense id="n35117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the part of a building enclosing the court-yard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounded by columns on the inside</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:44:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 44, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Urb. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perite: <entryFree id="n35118" type="main" key="pe^ri_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. peritus <sense id="n35118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perithous: <entryFree id="n35119" type="main" key="Pe_ri_tho^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pērīthŏus</orth>, <itype>i, corrupt form for Pirithous</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
peritia: <entryFree id="n35120" type="main" key="pe^ri_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrītĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peritus</etym>, <sense id="n35120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">experience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knowledge gained by experience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practical knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skill</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n35120.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum et militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futurorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra metandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 32</bibl></cit>: gratiae ac voluptatis<pb n="1346" /> <cb n="PERJ" />  (conciliandae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis pugnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:31:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 31, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35120.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte servi vel peritiā uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35120.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritiā et arte praestans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona senum multa peritia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 25, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perito: <entryFree id="n35121" type="spur" key="pe^ri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, a false read. for perit and perlit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 710</bibl>.</entryFree>
peritonaeos: <entryFree id="n35122" type="greek" key="pe^ri^to^naeos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭtŏnaeos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">perito/naios</foreign>, <sense id="n35122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the peritoneum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peritoneal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:4:57" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 4, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:4:7:93" default="NO">4, 7, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peritonaeum: <entryFree id="n35123" type="greek" key="pe^ri^to^naeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭtŏnaeum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭtŏnēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perito/naion</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">perito/neion</foreign>, <sense id="n35123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the membrane enclosing the intestines contained in the abdomen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the peritoneum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl>, and 7, 4, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
peritus: <entryFree id="n35124" type="main" key="pe^ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prop. <mood>Part.</mood> of perior (in ex-perior);
