root par-, per-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pera/w</foreign>; v. periculum</etym>, <sense id="n35124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">experienced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practically acquainted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expert</hi> (cf.: gnarus, consultus). </sense><sense id="n35124.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35124.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil iam mihi novi Offerri pote, quin sim peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctos homines vel usu peritos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docti a peritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hominibus callidis ac peritis animadversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decede peritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me peritus discet Iber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 20, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo peritissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem peritissimum in eis ipsis rebus, superare, quas, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritissimi duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 7</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n35124.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multarum rerum peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitatis nostrae et scriptorum veterum litterate peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:205" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 56, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum regionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestium prodigiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritiores rei militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum omnium peritissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:23:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 23, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritissimi caeli ac siderum vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir movendarum lacrimarum peritissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">definiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35124.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: jure peritus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 62</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">jure peritissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 19" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis jure peritior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 38, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritus bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritus disciplinā militari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte fabricā peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35124.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad usum et disciplinam peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ad respondendum et ad cavendum peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad prospicienda cavendaque pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive in amore rudis, sive peritus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 82.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de agriculturā peritissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">arma virumque peritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 137</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">soli cantare periti Arcades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritus obsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urentes oculos inhibere perita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex peritus, fortius adversus Romanos aurum esse quam ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrītissĭ-mus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a man of extraordinary skill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum discendi causā duobus peritissimis operam dedisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 42, 154</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35124.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract things, <hi rend="ital">skilfully constructed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritae fabulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 92</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an experienced manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expertly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleverly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod institutum perite a Numa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perite et ornate dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">callide et perite versari in aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distributa perite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 81</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritius fit aliquid ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid peritissime et callidissime venditare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:11:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavissime et peritissime legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perixyomenos: <entryFree id="n35125" type="main" key="pe^rixy^o^me^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrixyŏmĕnos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pericuo/menos</foreign>, <sense id="n35125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scraping himself</hi> (in the bath), the name of a statue by Antigonus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perizoma: <entryFree id="n35126" type="gloss" key="pe^rizo_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrizōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/zwma</foreign>, <sense id="n35126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a girdle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perjeratiuncula: <entryFree id="n35127" type="hapax" key="perje^ra_ti^uncula"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perjĕrātĭuncula</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>perjero</etym>, <sense id="n35127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a petty perjury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasiticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perjero: <entryFree id="n35128" type="main" key="perje^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perjĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. pejero.</entryFree>
perjucunde: <entryFree id="n35129" type="main" key="perju_cunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perjūcundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perjucundus <sense id="n35129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perjucundus: <entryFree id="n35130" type="main" key="perju_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-jūcundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very pleasing</hi>: cui quidem litterae tuae perjucundae fuerunt, Cic. Fam. <cb n="PERL" /> 1, 7, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>.—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">id mihi pergratum perque jucundum erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pergrata perque jucunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 205</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-jūcundē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very agreeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very pleasantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versari in aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 52, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perjuriosus: <entryFree id="n35131" type="hapax" key="perju_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perjūrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perjurium</etym>, <sense id="n35131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of perjury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfidious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perjurium: <entryFree id="n35132" type="main" key="perju_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perjūrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perjurus</etym>, <sense id="n35132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a false oath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perjury.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35132.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perjuri caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons viti et perjuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex animi tui sententiā juraris, id non facere perjurium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjurii poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleratorum hominum perjuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deum genitor fraudem et perjuria Cercopum exosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:681" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 681</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuras merito perjuria fallunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 657</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luimus perjuria Trojae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 502</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 542</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 185</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuria dictare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:218" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 218</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35132.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr.: perjuria Graia (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for perjuri Graii), <hi rend="ital">the perjured</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perfidious Greeks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:425" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 425</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perjuro: <entryFree id="n35133" type="main" key="perju_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perjūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. pejero.</entryFree>
perjurus: <entryFree id="n35134" type="main" key="perju_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perjūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>per-jus</etym>. <sense id="n35134.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">who breaks his oath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perjured</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid inter perjurum et mendacem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjurissimus leno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjura Troja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 811</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuri arte Sinonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuras puellas punire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8:53" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjura fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:174" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 174</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35134.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">who lies under oath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying</hi> (Plautin.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 74</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 164</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjurissime hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perlabor: <entryFree id="n35135" type="main" key="perla_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lābor</orth>, <itype>lapsus, 3</itype> (<sense id="n35135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> perlabier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 766</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to slip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glide through</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; perh. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl>, is also a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> reminiscence): <cit><quote lang="la">isque (aër) ita per nostras acies perlabitur omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 248</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:357" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 357</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:764" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 764</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla nec aërias volucris perlabitur auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:127" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:155" default="NO">4, 1, 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque rotis summas levibus perlabitur undas,</quote> <trans><tr>glides along the surface of the waves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nos vix tenuis famae perlabitur aura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 646</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde perlapsus ad nos et usque ad Oceanum Hercules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlaetus: <entryFree id="n35136" type="hapax" key="perlaetus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-laetus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very joyful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of joy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlapsus: <entryFree id="n35137" type="main" key="perlapsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlapsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perlabor.</entryFree>
perlate: <entryFree id="n35138" type="main" key="perla_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lātē</orth> <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very widely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very extensively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlate patere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlateo: <entryFree id="n35139" type="main" key="perla^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lătĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie completely hid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie hid always</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 416</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perlatio: <entryFree id="n35140" type="main" key="perla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perfero</etym>. <sense id="n35140.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bearing away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a conveying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transferring</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astron. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astron. 1 praef.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n35140.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">malorum perlatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlator: <entryFree id="n35141" type="main" key="perla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:28" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlatore capto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 146</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
perlatrix: <entryFree id="n35142" type="main" key="perla_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perlator</etym>, <sense id="n35142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that bears</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlatrices querelarum litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Ep. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlatus: <entryFree id="n35143" type="main" key="perla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perfero.</entryFree>
perlaudabilis: <entryFree id="n35144" type="main" key="perlauda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-laudābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very commendable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlavo: <entryFree id="n35145" type="main" key="perla^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lăvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bathe thoroughly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 4</bibl></cit>; Pelag. Vet. 26.</sense></entryFree>
perlaxo: <entryFree id="n35146" type="main" key="perlaxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlaxo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to relax greatly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perlecebra: <entryFree id="n35147" type="main" key="perle^ce_^bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlĕcē^bra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pellĕcē^bra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pellicio</etym>, <sense id="n35147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enticement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allurement</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">probri perlecebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit> (ap. Ritschl as one word, probriperlecebrae): <cit><quote lang="la">pellecebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlectio: <entryFree id="n35148" type="main" key="perlecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlectĭo</orth>, v. pellectio.</entryFree>
perlego: <entryFree id="n35149" type="main" key="perle^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĕgo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĕgo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:108 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 108 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 571</bibl> P.), <itype>lēgi, lectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35149.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to view all over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survey</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlege dispositas generosa per atria ceras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:591" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 591</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:499" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 499</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35149.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="PERL" /> <hi rend="ital">read through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">read to the end</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">has (tabellas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium (librum) de naturā deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando autem pelleget?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(libros) praesta bis ne perlegant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">33: leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:192" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 192</bibl></cit>: reliquum deincipe die perlecturus, App. Flor. n. 16.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine perlegam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35149.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to read</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">read aloud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges perlege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <trans><tr>to read over the names of all the senators</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlepide: <entryFree id="n35150" type="hapax" key="perle^pi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĕpĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very pleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very prettily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlepidus: <entryFree id="n35151" type="spur" key="perle^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĕpĭdus</orth>, a false read. for lepide, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 53</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
perlevis: <entryFree id="n35152" type="main" key="perle^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĕvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very slight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">momentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 34, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĕvĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very lightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very slightly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:25:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 25, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perlibens: <entryFree id="n35153" type="main" key="perli^bens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlĭbens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. perlibet <sense id="n35153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perlibenter: <entryFree id="n35154" type="main" key="perli^benter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlĭbenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perlibet <sense id="n35154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perliberalis: <entryFree id="n35155" type="main" key="perli_be^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lībĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very well bred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very genteel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lībĕrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very graciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very liberally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlibet: <entryFree id="n35156" type="main" key="perli^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĭbet</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-lŭbet</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n35156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is very pleasing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I should very much like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perlĭ-bens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-lŭbens</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">doing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seeing a thing very willingly</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with good will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pleasure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausculto perlubens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me perlubente allisus est,</quote> <trans><tr>to my great delight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perlĭbenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">per-lŭbenter</orth>), <hi rend="ital">very willingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with great pleasure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 14, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perlibratio: <entryFree id="n35157" type="main" key="perli_bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlībrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perlibro</etym>, <sense id="n35157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a levelling</hi> of water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perlibro: <entryFree id="n35158" type="main" key="perli_bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lībro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make exactly level</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to level.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35158.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">permensum et perlibratum opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planities non perlibrata, sed exigua prona,</quote> <trans><tr>not level</tr>, <tr>not horizontal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis Excelsa perlibrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35158.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hurl</hi> with a vibratory motion (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">saevamque bipennem Perlibrans mediae fronti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:189" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:321" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculum a tergo ad ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:699" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 699</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlicet: <entryFree id="n35159" type="gloss" key="perli^cet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĭcet</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n35159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is perfectly allowable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet, perlicet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlicio: <entryFree id="n35160" type="main" key="perli^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. pellicio.</entryFree>
perlimo: <entryFree id="n35161" type="main" key="perli_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-līmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n35161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to file;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to sharpen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make clearer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
perlinio: <entryFree id="n35162" type="main" key="perli^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĭnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. perlino.</entryFree>
perlino: <entryFree id="n35163" type="main" key="perli^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n35163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, lĭtum, 3, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĭnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to smear all over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pice liquidā perlinuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlinetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custos novum loculamentum perliniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit> (Schneid. perlinat): <cit><quote lang="la">servulum melle perlitum alligavit arbori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos unguedine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>, p. 138, 28: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem maculam perliniens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 13, 14</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 150</bibl>, read praebitus).—</sense><sense id="n35163.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassianae sententiae fuco perliti judices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perliquidus: <entryFree id="n35164" type="main" key="perli^qui^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĭquĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very liquid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
perliteratus: <entryFree id="n35165" type="main" key="perli_te^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lītĕrātus</orth>, v. perlitteratus.</entryFree>
perlito: <entryFree id="n35166" type="main" key="perli^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sacrifice very auspiciously</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">with very favorable omens</hi>: res divinae recte perlitatae, Val. Antias ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bove perlitare jussus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primis hostiis perlitatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu non perlitatum tenuerat dictatorem,</quote> <trans><tr>it being long before the sacrifices gave a favorable omen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlitteratus: <entryFree id="n35167" type="main" key="perlitte^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-littĕrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">perlītĕr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very learned</hi>: homo, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perlitus: <entryFree id="n35168" type="main" key="perli^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlĭtus</orth>, a. um, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perlino.</entryFree>
perlonge: <entryFree id="n35169" type="main" key="perlonge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlongē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perlongus <sense id="n35169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perlonginquus: <entryFree id="n35170" type="main" key="perlonginquus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-longinquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lasting very long</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perlongus: <entryFree id="n35171" type="main" key="perlongus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-longus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very long.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35171.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: perlongum. adverb., <hi rend="ital">for a very long time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very long</hi>, <pb n="1347" /> <cb n="PERM" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35171.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very tedious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perlongē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a very long way off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very far</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlonge est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlubens: <entryFree id="n35172" type="main" key="perlu^bens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlŭbens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. perlibet <sense id="n35172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perlubenter: <entryFree id="n35173" type="main" key="perlu^benter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlŭbenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perlibet <sense id="n35173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perlubet: <entryFree id="n35174" type="main" key="perlu^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlŭbet</orth>, v. perlibet.</entryFree>
perluceo: <entryFree id="n35175" type="main" key="perlu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlūcĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pell-</orth>), <itype>xi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>per-luceo</etym>, <sense id="n35175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be visible; to be seen through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be transparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pellucid</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n35175.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita is pellucet, quasi laterna Punica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis ac perlucens aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amethysti perlucent omnes violaceo colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlucens amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cretice, pelluces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>you wear a transparent Cretan garment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlucens toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlucens avena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with many holes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:71" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlucens ruina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellucet omnis regia (because the walls are fallen down),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Her. Fur. 1001" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Her. Fur. 1001</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35175.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shine through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appear; to be transparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud ipsum quod honestum decorumque dicimus quasi perlucet ex eis, quas commemoravi, virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellucens oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores dicentis ex oratione pelluceant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlucet omne regiae vitium domus,</quote> <trans><tr>is apparent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 148" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perluctuosus: <entryFree id="n35176" type="main" key="perluctu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-luctŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very mournful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perludo: <entryFree id="n35177" type="main" key="perlu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lūdo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play about</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 81</bibl> dub. (al. praelidere, al. praecludere).</sense></entryFree>
perlumino: <entryFree id="n35178" type="main" key="perlu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lūmĭno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illumine greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem caecam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
perluo: <entryFree id="n35179" type="main" key="perlu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lŭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pelluo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4</bibl>), <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wash bathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:435" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid aquā marinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem madentibus pennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 44, 61, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitientes artus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor perluit ora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 123</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wash one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bathe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perluitur solitā Titania lympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fluminibus perluuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 4</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 30, p. 166</bibl> Oud., read diffluens).</sense></entryFree>
perlusorius: <entryFree id="n35180" type="main" key="perlu_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlūsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perludo</etym>, <sense id="n35180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sportive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in sport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in jest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 14</bibl></cit> dub. (al. prolusorium).</sense></entryFree>
perlustro: <entryFree id="n35181" type="main" key="perlustro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-lustro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35181.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wander all through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to traverse completely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35181.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia (loca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlustrata armis tota Germania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:106:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 106, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35181.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to view all over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus materiae perlustrandae animo partes erunt omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu perlustrans oculis hostium turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:46:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 46, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlustra mea dicta,</quote> <trans><tr>examine</tr>, <tr>consult</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:143" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 143</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35181.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To purify</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hallow completely</hi> with religious acts: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphure et bitumine aliquid perlustrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perlutus: <entryFree id="n35182" type="main" key="perlu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perluo.</entryFree>
permaceo: <entryFree id="n35183" type="main" key="perma^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-măcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be very thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very weak</hi>: permaceat paries, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 524 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
permacer: <entryFree id="n35184" type="main" key="perma^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-măcer</orth>, <itype>cra, crum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very lean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro domestica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permacero: <entryFree id="n35185" type="main" key="perma_ce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mācĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to soften thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculos,</quote> <trans><tr>to slake completely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permadefacio: <entryFree id="n35186" type="main" key="perma^de^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mădĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wet through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drench thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor permadefecit cor meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permadesco: <entryFree id="n35187" type="main" key="perma^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mădesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become thoroughly wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quite moist.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35187.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi hibernis pluviis terra permaduerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1010.—</sense><sense id="n35187.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugite enervatam felicitatem, quā animi permadescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prov. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permaestus: <entryFree id="n35188" type="main" key="permaestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-maestus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-moestus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatly afflicted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dejected</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">interitu filiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permagnificus: <entryFree id="n35189" type="main" key="permagni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-magnĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sumptuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very magnificent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Esther, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permagnus: <entryFree id="n35190" type="main" key="permagnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-magnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very large</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:17:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 31</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">permagnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a very</hi> <cb n="PERM" /> <hi rend="ital">great thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">something very great</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permagnum existimans tris Olympionicas unā e domo prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permagni interest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permagni refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in tmesi: per enim magni aestimo tibi factum nostrum probari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decumas permagno vendere,</quote> <trans><tr>at a very high price</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:39:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 39, § 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permale: <entryFree id="n35191" type="main" key="perma^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-măle</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very badly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit> dub. (al. male).</sense></entryFree>
permananter: <entryFree id="n35192" type="main" key="perma_nanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permānanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>permano</etym>, <sense id="n35192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by flowing through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:916" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 916</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permanasco: <entryFree id="n35193" type="hapax" key="perma_nasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permānasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n35193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to flow to;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">to penetrate to</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem permanascere,</quote> <trans><tr>to penetrate to his ears</tr>, <tr>to reach his ears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permaneo: <entryFree id="n35194" type="main" key="perma^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mănĕo</orth>, <itype>mansi, mansum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stay to the end; to hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain; to persist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persevere</hi> (class.; syn.: persto, persevero). </sense><sense id="n35194.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam maxime permaneant diuturna corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira tam permansit diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenis jam ille mos a Cecrope permansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verris octo mensium incipit salire: permanet, ut id recte facere possit, ad trimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdiuturna, permanens ad longinquum et immensum paene tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 85</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad posteros nostros, Decret. Tergest. 2, 26: solus ad extremos permanet ille rogos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 105</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima quae mecum seros permansit in annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 73</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">adv. quo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo neque permaneant animae neque corpora nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 122</bibl></cit>; v. Lachm. ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n35194.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seleucus in maritimā orā permanens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pristinā sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proposito susceptoque consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n35194.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus sola permanet tenoris sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35194.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To abide in</hi> a way, rule, or mode of life, <hi rend="ital">to live by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to devote one's life to</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in proposito cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gratiā Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in peccato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in carne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eādem regulā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permano: <entryFree id="n35195" type="main" key="perma_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-māno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35195.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in saxis ac speluncis permanat aquarum Liquidus umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permanat calor argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia singula per quojusque foramina permanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 397</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:952" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 952</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:699" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 699</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35195.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to flow to</hi> any place; <hi rend="ital">to penetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi> anywhere (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: penetro, pervado): sucus permanat ad jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum in omnis partis corporis permanat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 62, 173</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 122</bibl>, the correct read. is permaneant; v. Lachm. ad h. l., and permaneo, <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n35195.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35195.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To penetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend to</hi> any place: <cit><quote lang="la">amor usque in pectus permanavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 253</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclusiunculae ad sensus non permanantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sermones hominum ad vestras aures permanarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:25:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 25, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macula permanat ad animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagorae doctrina permanavisse mihi videtur in hanc civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ubi uno auctore ad plures permanaverat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n35195.5" n="2" level="3"> Permanare palam, <hi rend="ital">to be divulged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become known</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permansio: <entryFree id="n35196" type="main" key="permansi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permansĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>permaneo</etym>, <sense id="n35196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a remaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persisting</hi> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">numquam laudata est in unā sententiā perpetua permansio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseverantia est in ratione bene consideratā stabilis et perpetua permansio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 18, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permarinus: <entryFree id="n35197" type="main" key="perma^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mărīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that accompanies through the sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lares,</quote> <trans><tr>marine Lares</tr>, <tr>guardian deities of those who travel by sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:52:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 52, 7</bibl></cit> (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> permarinūm); M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 3, 9</bibl>; cf.: permarini, <foreign lang="greek">diapo/ntioi</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
permaturesco: <entryFree id="n35198" type="main" key="perma_tu_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mātūresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become quite ripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ripen fully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi pomum permaturuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permaturo: <entryFree id="n35199" type="main" key="perma_tu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mātūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become quite ripe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi permaturavit (al. permaturuit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 136" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 136</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PERM" /></sense></entryFree>
permaturus: <entryFree id="n35200" type="main" key="perma_tu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mātūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quite ripe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permaxime: <entryFree id="n35201" type="main" key="permaxi^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permaxĭmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. permaximus <sense id="n35201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
permaximus: <entryFree id="n35202" type="main" key="permaxi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-maxĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very great indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremely great</hi>: solitudo, Porc. Latro Decl. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">permaxĭ-mē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38, 4</bibl> dub.; Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 69" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 69</bibl> (Schneid. maxime).</sense></entryFree>
permeabilis: <entryFree id="n35203" type="main" key="perme^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>permeo</etym>, <sense id="n35203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be passed through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permeator: <entryFree id="n35204" type="main" key="perme^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that passes through</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permeatus: <entryFree id="n35205" type="main" key="perme^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permĕātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the passage through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus permeatus suavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 228</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permediocris: <entryFree id="n35206" type="main" key="perme^di^o^cris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mĕdĭŏcris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very moderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 220</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permeditatus: <entryFree id="n35207" type="main" key="perme^di^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mĕdĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">well prepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well trained</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permensio: <entryFree id="n35208" type="main" key="permensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>permetior</etym>, <sense id="n35208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measuring out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <trans><tr>geometry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 725</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permensus: <entryFree id="n35209" type="main" key="permensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from permetior.</entryFree>
permeo: <entryFree id="n35210" type="main" key="perme^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35210.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphrates mediam Babylonem permeans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 26, 21, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpheus in eā insulā sub ima maria permeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 5, 30, § 55</bibl></cit>: in quos (barbaros) saxa et hastae longius permeabant, quam ut contrario sagittarum icto adaequarentur, <hi rend="ital">traversed too much space</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">went too far in reaching them</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ister permeat orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum littera nostra Tot maria ac terras permeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:11:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permeato amne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter, quo ab usque Pontico mari in Galliam permeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 13" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35210.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naviter et sine ullis concessationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35210.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to penetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pervade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quaedam animalis intellegentia per omnia ea permeet et transeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permereo: <entryFree id="n35211" type="hapax" key="perme^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mĕrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go through service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve out</hi> as a soldier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:74" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permessus: <entryFree id="n35212" type="main" key="Permessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Permessus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*permhsso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Bœotia sacred to Apollo and the Muses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which rises in Mount Helicon and flows into the Copaic lake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 64</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n35212.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Permessis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis or ĭdos</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Permessian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:77:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 77, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:70:3" default="NO">8, 70, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35212.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Permessĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Permessian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Seren. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permetior: <entryFree id="n35213" type="main" key="perme_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mētĭor</orth>, <itype>mensus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n35213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to measure through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measure out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measure</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n35213.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis magnitudinem, quasi decempedā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35213.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to travel through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>: (lupus femina) campos celeri passu permensa, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 18</bibl> (Ann. v. 74 Vahl.); so id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl> Müll.
