(Ann. v. 443 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad vos permensu'st viam,</quote> <trans><tr>came over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliae oras errabundus permetiens, Consol. ad Polyb. 36: classibus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:202" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secula,</quote> <trans><tr>to live through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:30:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in pass. signif., <hi rend="ital">measured out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permensum et perlibratum opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permenso tempore lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradatim permensis honoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 247, 25.</sense></entryFree>
permetuens: <entryFree id="n35214" type="spur" key="perme^tu^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mĕtŭens</orth>, a false read. for praemetuens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 573</bibl>.</entryFree>
permilito: <entryFree id="n35215" type="main" key="permi_li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mīlĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to serve out one's time as a soldier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permingo: <entryFree id="n35216" type="hapax" key="permingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mingo</orth>, <itype>minxi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n35216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make water upon</hi> one; hence, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">prosourei=n</foreign>, transf., i. q. stuprare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perminimus: <entryFree id="n35217" type="main" key="permi^ni^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mĭnĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exceedingly small</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 584</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perminutus: <entryFree id="n35218" type="spur" key="permi^nu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mĭnūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, a false read. for minutus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 30</bibl>.</entryFree>
permirabilis: <entryFree id="n35219" type="main" key="permi_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mīrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very wonderful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Genes. ad Litt. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Genes. ad Litt. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permirandus: <entryFree id="n35220" type="main" key="permi_randus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mīrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very wonderful</hi> (post-class.).—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">per hercle rem mirandam Aristoteles dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:27" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 27</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
permirus: <entryFree id="n35221" type="main" key="permi_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mīrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very wonderful</hi><pb n="1348" /> <cb n="PERM" />  (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi permirum videatur, quemquam exstare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 47, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vero mihi permirum accidit, fuisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">per mihi mirum visum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 214</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permisceo: <entryFree id="n35222" type="main" key="permisceo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-misceo</orth>, <itype>scŭi, stum, and xtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mingle together; to commingle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermingle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35222.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam cum materiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permixti cum suis fugientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permixtum senatui populi concilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites turbae hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus acerbitate permixti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:38:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 38, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 17, 67, § 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">generique cruorem Sanguine cum soceri permiscuit impius ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 801</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes in oratione esse quasi permixtos et confusos pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:195" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(gagates lapis) medetur strumis cerae permixtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 34, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora viva permista sepultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui totum ensem,</quote> <trans><tr>to plunge his whole sword into his body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:259" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 259</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35222.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35222.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to mix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mingle together; to commingle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermingle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tuas sordes cum clarissimorum virorum splendore permisceas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristia laetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:385" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminas e sanguine matris permistura domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbitas morum ne vino quidem permista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—Of language: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (intervallis longis et brevibus) implicata atque permixta oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:187" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 187</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35222.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to confound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw into confusion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50, § 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 17, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia divina humanaque jura permiscentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 348</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia gravi timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">permixtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (perh. not permistus in class. Lat.), <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n35222.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Promiscuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permixta caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 643</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1313" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1313</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <trans><tr>disordered</tr>, <tr>disorderly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 749</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35222.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Filled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permixtus maerore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 235</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mixtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promiscuously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:22:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 22, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 7, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permissio: <entryFree id="n35223" type="main" key="permissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>permitto</etym>. <sense id="n35223.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a giving up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yielding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ceding</hi> to another's will and pleasure; <hi rend="ital">an unconditional turrender</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35223.1" n="B" level="2"> A rhet. figure, in which a thing is committed to the decision of one's opponent, <hi rend="ital">permission</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 29, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:90" default="NO">9, 3, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35223.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permission</hi> (very rare for permissus): <cit><quote lang="la">mea permissio mansionis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine permissione Dei diabolus nocere non potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permissor: <entryFree id="n35224" type="main" key="permissor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permissor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a permitter</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permissum: <entryFree id="n35225" type="main" key="permissum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>permitto</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, A.</entryFree>
permissus: <entryFree id="n35226" type="main" key="permissus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from permitto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35227" type="main" key="permissus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permissus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>permitto</etym>, <sense id="n35227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permission</hi>, class. and freq. in <case>abl.</case> with <hi rend="ital">gen. of person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by one's leave</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">permissu legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 14, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 19, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">permissu tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 21, 14</bibl>; 7, 7, 8 al.: citra permissum praetoris; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 26, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permistus: <entryFree id="n35228" type="main" key="permistus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permistus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">permixt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. permisceo.</entryFree>
permitialis: <entryFree id="n35229" type="main" key="permi^ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permĭtĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>permities</etym>, <sense id="n35229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fatal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruinous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod nusquam sine permitiali Discidio potis est sejungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 451</bibl></cit> Munro (Lachm. perniciali).</sense></entryFree>
permities: <entryFree id="n35230" type="main" key="permi^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permĭtĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ĭcĭes</orth>), <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>per and root mi-; Sanscr. mi-, perire; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">minu/w, mei/wn</foreign>; Lat. minor, minimus; a distinct word from pernicies, v. Corss. Krit. Beit. p. 266 sq.; Munro ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 451</bibl>; Koch, Exercitt. Crit. in Prisc. Poët. Rom., Bonn. 1851, p. 9; cf. contra, Bergk, Beit. z. Lat. Gram. 1, 154 sq.; Ussing ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 132</bibl>; Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 3</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n35230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wasting away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perishing; ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decay</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicies, labes, exitium): erilis permicies, of a slave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit> Ritschl; also in all MSS. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 130</bibl>; and in good MSS. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 153</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">218</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permitis: <entryFree id="n35231" type="main" key="permi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mītis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very mild</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:41:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 41, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permitto: <entryFree id="n35232" type="main" key="permitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to let go through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer to pass through.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35232.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): fenestellae permittant columbas<cb n="PERM" />  ad introitum exitumque, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 24, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n35232.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to let go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let loose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos permittunt in hostem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ride at full speed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61</bibl></cit>: equum concitatum ad hostium aciem, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 162, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se incautius in hostem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to rush upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl></cit>: multi ex summo se permitterent, <hi rend="ital">sprang down</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 162, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregem campo,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn out into</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 7</bibl></cit>.—Mid., <hi rend="ital">to spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>: odor possit permitti longius, <hi rend="ital">spreads farther</hi>, Lucr 4, 688: <cit><quote lang="la">deserta regio ad Arimphaeos usque permittitur,</quote> <trans><tr>extends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:20" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35232.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35232.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To send away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">export</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseos trans maria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35232.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To let fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw</hi>, so as to reach the mark: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum permittit in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 282</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācumque datur permittere visus,</quote> <trans><tr>to direct</tr>, <tr>cast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:534" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 534</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35232.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35232.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To let loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let go</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatum,</quote> <trans><tr>to make free use of</tr>, <tr>exercise without reserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad aliquam rem,</quote> <trans><tr>to strive after a thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:92" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35232.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: committo, commendo): totum ei negotium permisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permittitur infinita potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem judicum potestati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui summam belli administrandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunas suas fidei alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui licentiam agendarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 103, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permissum ipsi erat, faceret, quod vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>to give one his life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminas maribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>: permittere se, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surrender one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suaque omnia in fidem atque potestatem populi Romani permittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suaque omnia eorum potestati permittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in deditionem consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:49" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 49</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n35232.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sino, patior): neque discessisset a me, nisi ego ei permisissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi permitto respondere, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis Antonio permisit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:90:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 90, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsis judicibus conjecturam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi permisso, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tuto transire permittatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permissus ut regnaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:12:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:90:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 90, 368</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non permittitur reprimere impetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:7:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si conjectare permittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 99</bibl></cit>: permittere sibi, with a foll. object-clause, <hi rend="ital">to allow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">permit one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to venture</hi> to do a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl>.— So with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil non permittit mulier sibi, Juv 6, 457: permitto aliquid iracundiae tuae,</quote> <trans><tr>to make allowance for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias sibi cum aliquo susceptas patribus conscriptis et temporibus rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>to sacrifice them to the state of the country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">permis-sus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n35232.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Permitted;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">permissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a permission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utor permisso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 80, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35232.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Let go</hi>, Plaut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=215" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 215</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
permixte: <entryFree id="n35233" type="main" key="permixte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permixtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. permisceo, <sense id="n35233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
permixtim: <entryFree id="n35234" type="main" key="permixtim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permixtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>permisceo</etym>, <sense id="n35234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promiscuously</hi> (post-class.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 191: <cit><quote lang="la">exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:20:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permixtio: <entryFree id="n35235" type="main" key="permixti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permixtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">permistĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n35235.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mixing together;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">ingredients mixed together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mixture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:12:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 12, 37</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n35235.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a mixture</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 20</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n35235.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A confusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae permixtio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 41" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissensio civilis, quasi permixtio terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
permixtus: <entryFree id="n35236" type="main" key="permixtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permixtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">permistus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from permisceo.</entryFree>
permodestus: <entryFree id="n35237" type="main" key="permo^destus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mŏdestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very modest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl>, b, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">verba sensu permodesto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permodice: <entryFree id="n35238" type="main" key="permo^di^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permŏdĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. permodicus <sense id="n35238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
permodicus: <entryFree id="n35239" type="main" key="permo^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mŏdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very small</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 24, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mŏdĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very little</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permoestus: <entryFree id="n35240" type="main" key="permoestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-moestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. permaestus.</entryFree>
permoleste: <entryFree id="n35241" type="main" key="permo^leste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permŏlestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. permolestus <sense id="n35241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="PERM" /></sense></entryFree>
permolestus: <entryFree id="n35242" type="main" key="permo^lestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mŏlestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very troublesome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hi non sunt permolesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">permŏlestē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with much trouble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permoleste ferre aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to be much vexed at a thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 17, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permollis: <entryFree id="n35243" type="main" key="permollis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mollis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very soft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod etiam in carminibus est permolle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permolo: <entryFree id="n35244" type="main" key="permo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mŏlo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grind up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35244.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">piperis grana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 19, 334</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35244.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">alienas uxores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permoneo: <entryFree id="n35245" type="main" key="permo^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permŏnĕo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to admonish</hi> (late Lat.), Primas. in Apoc. 5, 18.</sense></entryFree>
permonstrans: <entryFree id="n35246" type="hapax" key="permonstrans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-monstrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [monstro], <sense id="n35246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">showing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">explaining accurately</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permorior: <entryFree id="n35247" type="main" key="permo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>mŏri</itype>, <sense id="n35247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Instruct. 27</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permoror: <entryFree id="n35248" type="gloss" key="permo^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mŏror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n35248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to delay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tarry long</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permotatus: <entryFree id="n35249" type="main" key="permo_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mōtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [moto], <sense id="n35249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatly moved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently excited</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino permotati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Instruct. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permotio: <entryFree id="n35250" type="main" key="permo_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>permoveo</etym>. <sense id="n35250.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a moving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exciting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excitement</hi>, trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis permotio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: permotionis causā, <hi rend="ital">in order to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stir the feelings</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 2, 53, 216</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35250.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an emotion</hi> of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">permotiones istae animis nostris datae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permotus: <entryFree id="n35251" type="main" key="permo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from permoveo.</entryFree>
permoveo: <entryFree id="n35252" type="main" key="permo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>mōvi, mōtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stir up thoroughly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35252.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mare permotum ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram sarritione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resinae uncias tres dolio immergunt et permovent,</quote> <trans><tr>to stir about</tr>, <tr>shake up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35252.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35252.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the mind, <hi rend="ital">to move deeply; to stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite; to influence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">induce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail on</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quem aratorum fugae, calamitates, exilia, suspendia denique non permovent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commovendis judicibus, iis sensibus permoveor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 38, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pollicitationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labore itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive iracundiā, sive dolore, sive metu permotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus adducti atque auctoritate Orgetorigis permoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes dominandi studio permota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 3</bibl></cit>: mente permotus, <hi rend="ital">in an ecstasy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frenzy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35252.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi> a passion (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam, misericordiam, metum et iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permulceo: <entryFree id="n35253" type="main" key="permulce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mulcĕo</orth>, <itype>mulsi, sum, and ctum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stroke.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35253.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ut pulverem Manibus isdem, quibus Ulixi saepe permulsi, abluam, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 13</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 90 Rib.); so, aliquem manu, Ov F. 4, 551: capite permulso, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 871</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 733</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35253.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35253.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch gently</hi>: aram flatu permulcet spiritus austri, <hi rend="ital">blows softly upon</hi>, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 44, 114: <cit><quote lang="la">arteriae leni voce permulsae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicatā lumina virgā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 716</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35253.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To soften</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera picem lenitate permulcet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 10, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35253.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35253.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fondle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensum voluptate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 49, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem permulcere atque allicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures cantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:292" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his verbis vacuas permulceat auris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35253.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To soothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum animis permulsis et confirmatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:816" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 816</bibl></cit>: liberalibus verbis permulcti sunt, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 871</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">iram alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem mitibus verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitate militem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectutem,</quote> <trans><tr>to mitigate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permulctus: <entryFree id="n35254" type="main" key="permulctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permulctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from permulceo.</entryFree>
permulsio: <entryFree id="n35255" type="main" key="permulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permulsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>permulceo</etym>, <sense id="n35255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stroking</hi>: manuum, Non. s. v. mansuetum, p. 59, 25.</sense></entryFree>
permulsus: <entryFree id="n35256" type="main" key="permulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from permulceo.</entryFree>
permulto: <entryFree id="n35257" type="main" key="permulto_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permultō</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">permultum</orth>, v. permultus <sense id="n35257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <pb n="1349" /> <cb n="PERN" /></sense></entryFree>
permultus: <entryFree id="n35258" type="main" key="permultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-multus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very many</hi> (class.): nescio quantulum attulerit; <cit><quote lang="la">verum haud permultum attulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permultum erit ex maerore tuo diminutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permultum interest, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulta rogatus Fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 97</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n35258.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">permultō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by far</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulto clariora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:61:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 61, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulta mihi recurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35258.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">permultum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permultum ante,</quote> <trans><tr>very frequently before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permundo: <entryFree id="n35259" type="main" key="permundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mundo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse thoroughly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
permundus: <entryFree id="n35260" type="main" key="permundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very cleanly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permunio: <entryFree id="n35261" type="main" key="permu_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mūnĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fortify completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to finish fortifying</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n35261.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae munimenta incohaverat, permunit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permunitas Athenas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35261.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to fortify completely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris permunitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum opportuna permunivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permutatio: <entryFree id="n35262" type="main" key="permu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">permūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>permuto</etym>. <sense id="n35262.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A changing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alteration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:34:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 34, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicissitudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35262.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An interchanging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exchanging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exchange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim emptiones, partim permutationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec res permutationem non recipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:51" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst, 3:141" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst, 3, 141</bibl>. —Of <hi rend="ital">exchanging</hi> money, <hi rend="ital">negotiating</hi> a bill of exchange, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35262.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A substitution.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35262.3" n="1" level="3"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">of one expression for another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permutation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 34, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35262.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of one person for another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">similis si permutatio detur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:653" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 653</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
permuto: <entryFree id="n35263" type="main" key="permu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-mūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35263.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To change throughout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to alter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">change completely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem rei publicae statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine permutato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 827</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35263.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to interchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exchange</hi> one thing for another: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur valle permutem Sabinā Divitias operosiores?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jecore locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 80, § 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virus ut hoc alio fallax permutet odore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:93:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 93, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum gemmis,</quote> <trans><tr>for precious stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 48, § 163</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">permutatā ratione,</quote> <trans><tr>on the contrary</tr>, <tr>conversely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35263.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in the lang. of business. </sense><sense id="n35263.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To exchange</hi> money: <cit><quote lang="la">placuit denarium sedecim assibus permutari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 45</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of payments by exchange: <cit><quote lang="la">illud, quod tecum permutavi,</quote> <trans><tr>what you remitted to me by bill of exchange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait se curasse, ut cum quaestu populi permutaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quaero, quod illi opus erit Athenis, permutari ne possit, an ipsi ferendum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim cures, ut permutetur, Athenas, quod sit in annum sumptum ei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35263.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To buy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos talentis auri permutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serichatum permutatur in libras denariis sex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 21, 45, § 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:20" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 1, 4, § 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35263.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To turn about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn round</hi> (post.-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">arborem in contrarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:210" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 40, 77, § 210</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perna: <entryFree id="n35264" type="main" key="perna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/rna</foreign>. <sense id="n35264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a haunch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ham together with the leg.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35264.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35264.2" n="A" level="2"> Of men: is (i. e. his, militibus) pernas succidit, Enn. ap. Fest. pp. 304 and 305 (Ann. v. 279 Vahl.) (for which, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51</bibl>: succisis feminibus poplitibusque).—</sense><sense id="n35264.3" n="B" level="2"> Of animals, esp. of swine, <hi rend="ital">a thigh-bone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the meat upon it to the knee-joint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a leg</hi> of pork, <hi rend="ital">a ham</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gammon</hi> of bacon: <cit><quote lang="la">addito ungulam de pernā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter olus fumosae cum pede pernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: ossa ex acetabulis pernarum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35264.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things of a similar shape. </sense><sense id="n35264.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-mussel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernae concharum generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35264.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A part of the body of a tree sticking to its suckers when pulled off</hi>: stolones<cb n="PERN" />  cum pernā suā avelluntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 13, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pernarius: <entryFree id="n35265" type="gloss" key="perna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perna</etym>, <sense id="n35265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ham-seller</hi>, Inscr. Giorn. Arcad. t. 28, p. 358.</sense></entryFree>
pernarro: <entryFree id="n35266" type="gloss" key="pernarro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-narro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to narrate completely</hi>: pernarro, <foreign lang="greek">a)fhgou=mai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pernavigatus: <entryFree id="n35267" type="main" key="perna_vi^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nāvĭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [navigo], <sense id="n35267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sailed through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pernecessarius: <entryFree id="n35268" type="main" key="perne^cessa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nĕcessārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n35268.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very necessary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:11:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 11, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35268.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very closely connected</hi> with one: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 50, 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro homine intimo ac mihi pernecessario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 69</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus familiaris et Leptae nostri familiarissimi pernecessarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernecesse: <entryFree id="n35269" type="main" key="perne^cesse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nĕcesse</orth>, <sense id="n35269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. indecl.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very necessary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indispensably necessary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pernecesse esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Tull. 21, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perneco: <entryFree id="n35270" type="main" key="perne^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nĕco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slay outright</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 17</bibl> (21).</sense></entryFree>
pernego: <entryFree id="n35271" type="main" key="perne^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nĕgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35271.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To deny altogether; to deny steadily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stoutly</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">flatly</hi>: Negas? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Pernego immo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernegabo atque obdurabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe appellati, pernegaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyxidem traditam pernegaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 27, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35271.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To refuse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decline altogether</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Catoni populus Romanus praeturam negavit, consulatum pernegavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:82:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 82, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perneo: <entryFree id="n35272" type="main" key="perne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nĕo</orth>, <itype>nēvi, nētum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spin out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spin to an end</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of the Fates: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mihi supremos Lachesis perneverit annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:89:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 89, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pernetus: <entryFree id="n35273" type="main" key="perne_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perneo.</entryFree>
perniciabilis: <entryFree id="n35274" type="main" key="perni^ci^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭcĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pernicies</etym>, <sense id="n35274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruinous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pernicious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id perniciabile reo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nix oculis perniciabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentia quae magis in morbos longos quam in perniciabilis evasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernicialis: <entryFree id="n35275" type="main" key="perni^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernicies: <entryFree id="n35276" type="main" key="perni^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭcĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype> (old form of the <sense id="n35276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> pernicii or pernici, Sisenn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14, 12</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 486, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14, 19</bibl>, and acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 486, 28</bibl>. But Charis., p. 53 P., gives for the passages of Cicero above cited the form pernicies; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, also,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 281</bibl></cit> P.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> pernicie, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13, 5</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>; v. also, permities), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perneco</etym>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamity</hi> (syn.: exitium, labes). </sense><sense id="n35276.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantā in pernicie siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pernicie populi Romani et exitio hujus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbam perniciem meam cum magnā calamitate rei publicae esse conjunctam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciem rei publicae moliens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tuā peste ac pernicie cumque eorum exitio, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incumbere ad perniciem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:28:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 28, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in apertam perniciem incurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perniciem vocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: Romanos inferendae pernicii causā venisse, Sisenn. ap. Gell. and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui perniciem machinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciem invenire sibi et aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicies in accusatorem vertit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nepotum Perniciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35276.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., a person or thing that is ruinous or baleful, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egredere, erilis pernicies, ex aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit> Lorenz (Ritschl, permicies): <cit><quote lang="la">perlecebrae, pernicies, adulescentum exitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legirupa, pernicies adulescentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 130</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">leno, pernicies communis adulescentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicies provinciae Siciliae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Verres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam perniciem exstinxit ac sustulit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Clodius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphae vini pernicies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripite hanc pestem perniciemque mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:76:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 76, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicies et tempestas barathrumque macelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 31</bibl></cit>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pernicio: <entryFree id="n35277" type="main" key="perni^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perneco</etym>, <sense id="n35277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (late Lat. for the class. pernicies), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 6</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
perniciose: <entryFree id="n35278" type="main" key="perni^ci^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭcĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perniciosus <sense id="n35278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="PERN" /></sense></entryFree>
perniciosus: <entryFree id="n35279" type="main" key="perni^ci^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭcĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pernicies</etym>, <sense id="n35279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruinous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baleful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pernicious</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">exitialis, capitalis): perniciosae leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta auctori perniciosa suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 68</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi animi perniciosiores sunt, quam corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciosissimum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 113, 2</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭcĭōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">baneful things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter perniciosissima numerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭcĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">destructively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruinously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perniciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa perniciose, multa pestifere sciscuntur in populis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriat vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 178</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pernicitas: <entryFree id="n35280" type="main" key="perni_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernīcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pernix</etym>, <sense id="n35280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nimbleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briskness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swiftness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleetness</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pernicitas deserit: consitus sum senectute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adde pernicitatem et velocitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:15:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 15, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum pernicitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines saltatim currentes, vivacissimae pernicitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perniciter: <entryFree id="n35281" type="main" key="perni_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernīcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pernix <sense id="n35281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perniger: <entryFree id="n35282" type="main" key="perni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nĭger</orth>, <itype>gra, grum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very black</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis pernigris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 153</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernimium: <entryFree id="n35283" type="main" key="perni^mi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭmĭum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pernimius.</entryFree>
