pernimius: <entryFree id="n35284" type="main" key="perni^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nĭmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quite too great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altogether too much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium inter vos ac pernimium interest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in tmesi: per parce nimium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭmĭum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">altogether too much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretatio pernimium severa,</quote> <trans><tr>altogether too severe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernio: <entryFree id="n35285" type="main" key="perni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perna</etym>, <sense id="n35285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kibe on the foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chilblain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 37, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:109" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 6, 58, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:221" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 16, 62, § 221</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perniteo: <entryFree id="n35286" type="main" key="perni^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nĭtĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine very much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora pernitent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:9:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perniunculus: <entryFree id="n35287" type="main" key="perni^uncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernĭuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pernio</etym>, <sense id="n35287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chilblain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 66, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pernix: <entryFree id="n35288" type="main" key="pernix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> pernici, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 559</bibl>: <sense id="n35288.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">pernice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 635</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>per-nitor, qs. striving or pressing through</etym>, <hi rend="ital">nimble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brisk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleet</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">levis, praepes, celer, promptus): pernix sum manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum pernicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 718</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti milibus juvenum velocitate pernicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:34:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugis adventu pernix Saturnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicis uxor Appuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:41" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus celerem et pernicibus alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis pernicissimi celeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 47, 71, § 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35288.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amata relinquere pernix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 165</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pernīcĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">nimbly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swiftly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo desilire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exilire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alites alte perniciterque volantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 14, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernobilis: <entryFree id="n35289" type="main" key="perno_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nōbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very famous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epigramma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Abydos Leandri Amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernoctatio: <entryFree id="n35290" type="main" key="pernocta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernoctātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pernocto</etym>, <sense id="n35290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a passing the night</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pernocto: <entryFree id="n35291" type="main" key="pernocto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nocto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stay all night long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass the night</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n35291.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris non est pernoctandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem pernoctare perpetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ibi pernoctaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 38</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">pro me pernoctet epistula tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18</bibl></cit> 217: <cit><quote lang="la">cum salibus, i. e. in pickle (of olives),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina pernoctantia,</quote> <trans><tr>shining all night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35291.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec studia pernoctant nobiscum, peregrinantur, rusticantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 7, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernonides: <entryFree id="n35292" type="main" key="Perno_ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pernōnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perna</etym>, a comically formed patronymic, qs. <sense id="n35292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">descended from a ham</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laridum Pernonidem,</quote> <trans><tr>a bit of ham</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernosco: <entryFree id="n35293" type="main" key="pernosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nosco</orth>, <itype>ōvi, ōtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35293.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To examine thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernoscite, Furtumne factum existimetis, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have examined</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discerned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to know thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become thoroughly acquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get a correct knowledge of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium avidi haud pernoram hospitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta pernovit probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernovi equidem ingenium tuum ingenuom admodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35293.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To learn thor</hi> <pb n="1350" /> <cb n="PERO" /> <hi rend="ital">oughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become fully acquainted with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum mores ex corpore, oculis, vultu, etc., pernoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus animorum sunt penitus oratori pernoscendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pernōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">thoroughly known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugil ob eximiam virtutem virium regi pernotus et gratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 14, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pernotesco: <entryFree id="n35294" type="main" key="perno_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernōtesco</orth>, <itype>tŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become everywhere</hi> or <hi rend="ital">generally known</hi> (post-Aug.). —<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi incolumem esse pernotuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">13, 25: nova culpa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernotus: <entryFree id="n35295" type="main" key="pe^rno_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrnōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pernosco.</entryFree>
pernox: <entryFree id="n35296" type="main" key="pernox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nox</orth>, <itype>noctis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">continuing through the night</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that lasts all night</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">(bos) jacet pernox instrato cubili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna pernox erat,</quote> <trans><tr>was up all night</tr>, <tr>was at her full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49:9" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 49, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">addit et exceptas lunā pernocte pruinas,</quote> <trans><tr>by the light of the full moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 268</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">luna alias pernox, alias sera, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare pertinaci statu perdius atque pernox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luditur alea pernox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernoxius: <entryFree id="n35297" type="main" key="pernoxi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-noxĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very harmful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very dangerous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pernubilo: <entryFree id="n35298" type="main" key="pernu_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nūbĭlo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to darken</hi> (late Lat.), Vict. Turon. Poenit. 10.</sense></entryFree>
pernumero: <entryFree id="n35299" type="main" key="pernu^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-nŭmĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to count out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:62:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 62, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res hereditarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:9:1:section=24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 9, 1, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pernunculus: <entryFree id="n35300" type="gloss" key="pernuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>perna</etym>, <sense id="n35300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ham</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pernuntio: <entryFree id="n35301" type="gloss" key="pernunti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pernuntĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to announce</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pero: <entryFree id="n35302" type="main" key="pe_ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of boot made of raw hide</hi>, worn chiefly by soldiers and wagoners (cf. caliga): <cit><quote lang="la">crudus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alto per glaciem perone tegi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:186" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 186</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 465</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perones effeminati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35303" type="main" key="Pe_ro_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pērō</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*phrw/</foreign>, <sense id="n35303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Neleus and wife of Bias</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl> (2, 3, 53).</sense></entryFree>
perobscurus: <entryFree id="n35304" type="main" key="pe^robscu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-obscūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very obscure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perodi: <entryFree id="n35305" type="main" key="pe^ro_di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ōdi</orth>, <itype>ōsus, ōdisse</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hate greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to detest</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">plebs consulum nomen perosa erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 34, 8</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes, qui legitimam disciplinam non sint perosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 5, 2</bibl>: populum Romanum perosi sunt, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 409</bibl></cit>.—Usually, </sense><sense id="n35305.1" n="II" level="1"> In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n35305.2" n="A" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">detesting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hating greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem perosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus omne Femineum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Creten longumque perosus Exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:379" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achillem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:582" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 582</bibl></cit>; 14, 693; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbiam regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 39, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:16" default="NO">8, 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perosus decemvirorum scelera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign> 3, 41.—</sense><sense id="n35305.3" n="B" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">thoroughly hated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hateful</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">thalami,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas tanto perosior quanto plenior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil deo perosius gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Virg. Vel. 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hatefully</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perodiosus: <entryFree id="n35306" type="main" key="pe^ro^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ŏdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very grievous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very annoying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lippitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 22, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perofficiose: <entryFree id="n35307" type="hapax" key="pe^roffi^ci^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-offĭcĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very serviceably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very attentively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perofficiose et peramanter aliquem observare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peroleo: <entryFree id="n35308" type="main" key="pe^ro^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to emit a penetrating odor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perolesco: <entryFree id="n35309" type="main" key="pe^ro^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ŏlesco</orth>, <itype>lēvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 872</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
peronatus: <entryFree id="n35310" type="main" key="pe_ro_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pērōnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. pero</etym>, <sense id="n35310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having on boots of untanned leather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough-booted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:102" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peropacus: <entryFree id="n35311" type="main" key="pe^ro^pa_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ŏpācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very shady</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spelunca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peropportune: <entryFree id="n35312" type="main" key="pe^ropportu_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-opportūnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. peropportunus <sense id="n35312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peropportunus: <entryFree id="n35313" type="main" key="pe^ropportu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-opportūnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very seasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very convenient</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opportune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 57, 234</bibl></cit>: victoria, <cb n="PERP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 45, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕropportūnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very seasonably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very opportunety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna te obtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc cecidit quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peroptato: <entryFree id="n35314" type="main" key="pe^ropta_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-optātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>optatus</etym>, <sense id="n35314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very much to one's wish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peroptato nobis datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peropus: <entryFree id="n35315" type="main" key="pe^ro^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ŏpus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very necessary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peropus est, hunc cum ipsā colloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peroratio: <entryFree id="n35316" type="main" key="pe^ro_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peroro</etym>, <sense id="n35316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the finishing part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the close</hi> or <hi rend="ital">winding up of a speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the peroration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstat ejus peroratio, qui epilogus dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubent exordiri ... deinde rem narrare ... post autem dividere causam ... Tum alii conclusionem orationis et quasi perorationem collocant: alii jubent, antequam peroretur, digredi, deinde concludere, ac perorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:35:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 35, 122</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 33, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:37:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 37, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:15" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peroriga: <entryFree id="n35317" type="spur" key="pe^ro_ri_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrōrīga</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praeuriga</orth>, a false read. for per origam, i. e. aurigam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:8:4" default="NO">2, 8, 4</bibl>; v. Schne<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ad Varr. R. R. 2:7:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Varr. R. R. 2, 7, 8</bibl>.</entryFree>
perornatus: <entryFree id="n35318" type="main" key="pe^rorna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ornātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very ornate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus in dicendo perornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 43, 158</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perorno: <entryFree id="n35319" type="main" key="pe^rorno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-orno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to adorn greatly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peroro: <entryFree id="n35320" type="main" key="pe^ro_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to speak from beginning to end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">argue throughout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harangue at length</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n35320.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: QVOM PERORANT AMBO PRAESENTES, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra tales oratores tantam causam perorare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Quinto Hortensio causa est P. Sestii perorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et breviter peroratum esse potuit, nihil me commisisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus perorandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus horis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 51, 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Proculas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 67</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35320.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to bring a speech to a close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wind up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitu senatūs coactus est, aliquando perorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii jubent antequam peroretur digredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta est a me causa et perorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 29, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:15:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 15, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:48:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 48, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peroratā narratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam satis multa dixi, est mihi perorandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 48, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ceteris perorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35320.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring to an end; to conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">res illo die non peroratur, dimittitur judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:29:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 29, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quā cum dixero totum hoc crimen decumanum perorabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>, § 154; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 10, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35320.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To persuade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus adest precibus faciesque incesta perorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35320.5" n="III" level="1"> (Acc. to oro, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">To pray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring a prayer to an end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et hic quidem ita peroravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:15:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 15, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perosculor: <entryFree id="n35321" type="hapax" key="pe^roscu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-oscŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n35321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kiss again and again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos (uniones) perosculatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:81:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 81, 5</bibl></cit> dub. (al. deosculatur).</sense></entryFree>
perosus: <entryFree id="n35322" type="main" key="pe^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. perodi.</entryFree>
perpaco: <entryFree id="n35323" type="main" key="perpa_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pāco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to quiet completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce to quiet</hi> (i. q. perdomare): <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus perpacatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brennos perpacavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 33" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpallidus: <entryFree id="n35324" type="main" key="perpalli^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pallĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very pale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perparce: <entryFree id="n35325" type="main" key="perparce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-parcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sparingly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parsimoniously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perparce nimium facere sumptum,</quote> <trans><tr>altogether too sparing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perparum: <entryFree id="n35326" type="main" key="perpa^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-părum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very little</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perparvulus: <entryFree id="n35327" type="main" key="perparvu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-parvŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n35327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very small</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sigilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 53, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perparvus: <entryFree id="n35328" type="main" key="perparvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-parvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very small</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 216</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:588" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 588</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae et cum assunt perparva sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perparva et tenuis civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:38:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 38, § 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 57, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpasco: <entryFree id="n35329" type="main" key="perpasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pasco</orth>, <itype>pāvi, pastum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to graze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pasture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35329.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=95" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 95</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n35329.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpascor</orth>, <itype>ci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to lay waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastate</hi>: fluvius perpascitur agros, Sev. Aetn. 489.—Hence, <cb n="PERP" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpastus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">well fed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in good condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpauculus: <entryFree id="n35330" type="main" key="perpaucu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-paucŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n35330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very few</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deduxit in Academiam perpauculis passibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 54</bibl></cit>; M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 3</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
perpaucus: <entryFree id="n35331" type="main" key="perpaucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-paucus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very few</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in tmesi: per pol quam paucos reperias amatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si perpauca mutavisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perpauca loquens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens perpauca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 48, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:20:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 20, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpaululus: <entryFree id="n35332" type="main" key="perpaulu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-paulŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paullŭl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n35332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very little indeed;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-paulŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a very little indeed</hi>: perpaululum loci, v. l. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:35:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 35, 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpaulus: <entryFree id="n35333" type="main" key="perpaulus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-paulus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very little.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35333.1" n="I" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpaulum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a very little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:35:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 35, 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35333.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-paulum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a very little indeed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">declinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpauper: <entryFree id="n35334" type="main" key="perpauper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pauper</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very poor</hi>: vicinus, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 280, 25</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 157 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpauxillus: <entryFree id="n35335" type="main" key="perpauxillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pauxillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very little;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pauxillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a very little</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpavefacio: <entryFree id="n35336" type="hapax" key="perpa^ve^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-păvĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to frighten very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make one afraid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpedio: <entryFree id="n35337" type="main" key="perpe^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pĕdĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 238, 10</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 145 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
perpello: <entryFree id="n35338" type="main" key="perpello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pello</orth>, <itype>pŭli, pulsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">push violently.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35338.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; perh. not in Cic., for in Cic. Cæl. 15, 36, the true reading is pepulerunt): nixurit, qui niti vult, et in conatu saepius aliquā re perpellitur, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 144, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35338.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail upon</hi>: perpulit, persuasit, impulit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=216" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 216</bibl> Müll. (esp. freq. since the Aug. per.; in Curt. always with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>): si animus hominem perpulit, actum est; <cit><quote lang="la">animo servibit, non sibi: sin ipse animum perpulit, dum vixit, victor victorum cluet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidum senem callidis dolis compuli et perpuli, ut. etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam destitit Suadere, orare, usque adeo, donec perpulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aulum spe pactionis perpulerat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec perpelli potuere ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpellit, ut legatos ad Scipionem mittat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:32" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem perpellere ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> (so perh. only in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">Mithridates Pharasmanem perpulit dolo et vi conatus suos juvare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 39</bibl></cit> (33); 11, 29; 13, 54.—</sense><sense id="n35338.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To impress deeply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an impression on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candor hujus te et proceritas, voltus oculique perpulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpendicularis: <entryFree id="n35339" type="main" key="perpendi^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpendĭcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpen-dĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perpendiculum</etym>, <sense id="n35339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perpendicular</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Exposit. Form. p. 32" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Exposit. Form. p. 32</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
perpendiculator: <entryFree id="n35340" type="main" key="perpendi^cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpendĭcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an artisan who uses a plumb-line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stonemason</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 14" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpendiculatus: <entryFree id="n35341" type="main" key="perpendi^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpendĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perpendicular</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 593</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpendiculum: <entryFree id="n35342" type="main" key="perpendi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpendĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perpendo</etym>, <sense id="n35342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plummet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plumb-line.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35342.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: non egeremus perpendiculis, non normis, non regulis, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 163, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perpendiculum columnas exigere,</quote> <trans><tr>to examine by a plumb-line</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 51, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perpendiculum,</quote> <trans><tr>perpendicular</tr>, <tr>perpendicularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna non directa ad perpendiculum, sed prona et fastigiata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpendiculo respondere (opp. habere proclinationes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 1, 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35342.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perpendiculum seque suosque habuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestatem lenium morum velut ad perpendiculum librans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut ad perpendiculum aemulae urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>on a strict equality</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpendo: <entryFree id="n35343" type="main" key="perpendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pendo</orth>, <itype>pendi, pensum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh carefully</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exactly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35343.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in librili pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35343.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine; to ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi> (class.; syn.: delibero, expendo,<pb n="1351" /> <cb n="PERP" />  reputo): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid acri judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1042" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1042</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentissime perpendens momenta officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad disciplinae praecepta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc non arte aliquā perpenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicare et perpendere, quantum quisque possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 6:23" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: quid in amicitiā fieri oportet quae totā veritate perpenditur, <hi rend="ital">which is considered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">esteemed altogether according to its truth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulorum vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpendendum erit praetori, cui potius subveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante perpensum et exploratum habeamus, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo judicii perpensi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberatio perpensa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pensē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with deliberation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberately</hi> (post-class.); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 10, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpensatio: <entryFree id="n35344" type="main" key="perpensa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpensātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perpenso</etym>, <sense id="n35344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exact weighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a careful consideration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum atque officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpense: <entryFree id="n35345" type="main" key="perpense_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpensē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perpendo <sense id="n35345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perpenso: <entryFree id="n35346" type="main" key="perpenso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpenso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>perpendo</etym>, <sense id="n35346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh carefully;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 298</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 11, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpensus: <entryFree id="n35347" type="main" key="perpensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perpendo.</entryFree>
perperam: <entryFree id="n35348" type="main" key="perpe^ram"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕram</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕrē</orth>, <sense id="n35348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. perperus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perperitudo: <entryFree id="n35349" type="main" key="perpe^ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕrĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perperus</etym>, <sense id="n35349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heedlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtlessness</hi> (ante-class.), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perperna: <entryFree id="n35350" type="main" key="Perperna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Perperna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Perpenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> A famous person of this name was M. Perperna, <hi rend="ital">the murderer of Sertorius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was defeated by Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 27, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:30:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:20:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 20, 6</bibl>.—Form Perpenna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perperus: <entryFree id="n35351" type="greek" key="perpe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/rperos</foreign> (prop. heedless, inconsiderate; hence, in gen.), <sense id="n35351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not properly constituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defective</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrong</hi> (as <pos>adj.</pos> only ante- and postclass.): populares, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil perperum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 6</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. praeproperum).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n35351.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕram</orth> (<hi rend="ital">adv. acc. fem.</hi> like clam, coram, palam; and in the <number>plur.</number> alias, alteras), <hi rend="ital">wrongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorrectly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untruly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsely</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit> (Serv. ad loc.): si aspires perperam, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu recte, seu perperam fecerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte an perperam judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronunciare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35351.2" n="2" level="3"> In a milder signif., <hi rend="ital">erroneously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by mistake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita dico, ne ad alias aedis perperam deveneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:69:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 69, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perperam praeco non consulem, sed imperatorem pronunciavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Hisp. 12.—</sense><sense id="n35351.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wrongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opiniones perpere praesumptae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpes: <entryFree id="n35352" type="main" key="perpes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpes</orth>, <itype>ĕtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>like perpetuus, from per-peto</etym>, <sense id="n35352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lasting throughout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninterrupted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetual</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perpetem pro perpetuo dixerunt poëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=217" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 217</bibl></cit> Müll.: luna proprio suo perpeti candore, App. de Deo Socr. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:Flor. 3, p. 357:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 3, p. 357, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivus cruore fluebat perpeti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 42</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35352.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of time, <hi rend="ital">continuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">never ending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem perpetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte perpeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:7:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetem diem alternis pedibus insistunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per annum perpetem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpes aevi aeternitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:34" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 34</bibl></cit> Mai.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without intermission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetually</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 321, 5</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 21, § 44</bibl>, the correct read. is perpetuo; v. Sillig ad h. l., and Hand, Turs. 4, p. 465).</sense></entryFree>
perpessicius: <entryFree id="n35353" type="main" key="perpessi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpessīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perpetior</etym>, <sense id="n35353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can endure much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has endured much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">etiam a duro et perpessicio confessionem accipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 53, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socrates perpessicius senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 104:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 104, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpessio: <entryFree id="n35354" type="main" key="perpessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum rerum perpessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: laborum, id. Inv. <cb n="PERP" /> 2, 54, 163: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum arduarum ac difficilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudinis patientia et perpessio et tolerantia rami sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malae valetudinis et dolorum gravissimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 66:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 66, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpessitius: <entryFree id="n35355" type="main" key="perpessi_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpessītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. perpessicius.</entryFree>
perpessus: <entryFree id="n35356" type="main" key="perpessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perpetior.</entryFree>
perpetim: <entryFree id="n35357" type="main" key="perpe^tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perpes <sense id="n35357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perpetior: <entryFree id="n35358" type="main" key="perpe^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pĕtĭor</orth>, <itype>pessus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [patior], <hi rend="ital">to bear steadfastly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer with firmness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">patience; to stand out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi> (class.): animus aeger neque pati neque perpeti potis est, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 5</bibl> (Trag. v. 260 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">o multa dictu gravia, perpessu aspera, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 8, 20: facile omnes perpetior ac perfero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendicitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affirmavi quidvis me potius perpessurum, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus illi perpetienti erat voluptarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi omnia potius perpetienda esse duco, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem asperum et difficilem perpessu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:26:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 26, 72</bibl></cit>: audax omnia perpeti Gens humana, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to dare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brave</hi> every consequence, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:22:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 22, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina, noctem, imbres ... Perpetimur Danai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 472</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam tecum esse equidem facile possim perpeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque me perpetiar probri Falso insimulatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exscindine domos Perpetiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen hanc sacro violari pondere pinum Perpetiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 622</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: perpetiar memorare, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will collect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">control myself so as</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 466</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35358.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract things, <hi rend="ital">to endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put up with</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementius quam gracilitas mea perpeti posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpetrabilis: <entryFree id="n35359" type="main" key="perpe^tra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perpetro</etym>, <sense id="n35359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be done</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allowable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permissible</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Ux. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpetratio: <entryFree id="n35360" type="main" key="perpe^tra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a performing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">committing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetration</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 13:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 13, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpetrator: <entryFree id="n35361" type="main" key="perpe^tra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a performer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">committer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetrator</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">peccati, Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 1: caedis infaustae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpetro: <entryFree id="n35362" type="main" key="perpe^tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pĕtro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>patro</etym>, <sense id="n35362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">achieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish; to commit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetrate</hi> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.; not in Cic. or Cæs.; rare as <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.;</hi> syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">perago, exsequor, conficio): perpetrat, peragit, perficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=217" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 217</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">opus meum ut volui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primā parte (operis) perpetratā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=110" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 110</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetratā caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus, in quo perpetrata caedes erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id se facinus perpetraturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetrato sacro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 35, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificio rite perpetrato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 37, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace nondum perpetratā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetratis quae ad pacem deum pertinebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetrato bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 45, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 43, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (principis) jussu perpetratum ingenuitatis judicium erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad reliqua Judaici belli perpetranda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus perpetratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 15, 72 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetraret Anicetus promissa,</quote> <trans><tr>fulfil</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:18" default="NO">6, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo quasi perpetraturus bellum, imperavit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 46 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homicidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abominationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sibi manus intulit et non perpetravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:21:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring it to pass that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that ... not</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 11</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male quod mulier facere incepit, nisi si ecficere perpetrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpetualis: <entryFree id="n35363" type="main" key="perpe^tu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perpetuus</etym>, <sense id="n35363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that holds everywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">universal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi> (a word formed by Quint. as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kaqoliko/s</foreign>, joined with universalis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 14</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">permanently</hi> (opp. temporaliter), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpetuarius: <entryFree id="n35364" type="main" key="perpe^tu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">constant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permanent; always employed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constantly engaged</hi> in any business or calling <cb n="PERP" /> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fee-farmer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereditary tenant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 70, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpetuitas: <entryFree id="n35365" type="main" key="perpe^tu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perpetuus</etym>, <sense id="n35365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uninterrupted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">continual duration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninterrupted progress</hi> or <hi rend="ital">succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continuity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetuity</hi> (good prose;
