cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infinitas): non ex singulis vocibus philosophi spectandi sunt, sed ex perpetuitate atque constantiā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from their consistency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perpetuitatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to perpetuity</tr>, <tr>forever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitae perpetuitate,</quote> <trans><tr>through the whole course of our lives</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuitas verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>an unbroken succession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 54, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">et opacae perpetuitates,</quote> <trans><tr>unbroken tracts of land</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>. 1.</sense></entryFree>
perpetuito: <entryFree id="n35366" type="spur" key="perpe^tu^i^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, a false read. in Enn.; v. 2. perpetuo.</entryFree>
perpetuo: <entryFree id="n35367" type="main" key="perpe^tu^o_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perpetuus <sense id="n35367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35368" type="main" key="perpe^tu^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (old <sense id="n35368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> perpetuassint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:322" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 322</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>perpetuus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cause</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to continue uninterruptedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to proceed with continually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make perpetual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetuate</hi> (rare but class.): libertatem ut perpetuassint, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 30</bibl> (Ann. v. 322 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">amator qui perpetuat data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si cui sit infinitus spiritus datus, tamen eum perpetuare verba nolimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum potestatem perpetuandam ... putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 22, 64</bibl></cit>: di te perpetuent, <hi rend="ital">may the gods preserve you!</hi> a form of salutation addressed to the emperors, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpetuus: <entryFree id="n35369" type="main" key="perpe^tu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pĕtŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n35369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> perpetuior, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 601</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> perpetuissimus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>) [peto], <hi rend="ital">continuing throughout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbroken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninterrupted; constant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">universal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetual</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">continuus, assiduus): sulcos perpetuos ducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin aedes totae perpetuae ruant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites disposuit perpetuis vigiliisque stationibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuis soliti patres considere mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vescitur Aeneas ... perpetui tergo bovis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apenninus perpetuis jugis ab Alpibus tendens ad Siculum fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio perpetua (opp. altercatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:26:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 26, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones perpetuae hoc adulescente constitutae sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>a standing commission</tr>, <tr>a permanent tribunal for criminal investigation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 105</bibl></cit>: perpetua historia, <hi rend="ital">a continuous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">general history</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colere te usque perpetuom diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem perpetuum in laetitiā degere,</quote> <trans><tr>this whole day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triduum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis Vestae perpetuus ac sempiternus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex perpetua et aeterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum perennes cursus atque perpetui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 55</bibl></cit>. stabilis et perpetua permansio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas mea perpetua et constans in rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua et perpetua cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetui scrinia Sili,</quote> <trans><tr>of the immortal Silius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:64:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 64, 10</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the abiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permanent</hi> (opp. temporale), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 68</bibl>.—Hence: in perpetuum (sc. tempus), <hi rend="ital">for all time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in perpetuity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>: mulier repperit odium ocius Suā inmunditiā, quam in perpetuom ut placeat munditia sua. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serva tibi in perpetuom amicum me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in perpetuum comprimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 21, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinere aliquid in perpetuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in perpetuum irascetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:102:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 102, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.—So, in perpetuum modum = perpetuo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35369.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35369.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That holds constantly and universally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">universal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetui juris et universi generis quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec arbitror perpetuum quicquam in hoc praecipi posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id quidem perpetuum est,</quote> <trans><tr>does not always hold good</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: illud in quo quasi certamen est controversiae ... id ita dici placet, ut traducatur ad perpetuam quaestionem, <hi rend="ital">to a general principle</hi>, <pb n="1352" /> <cb n="PERP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 36, 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35369.3" n="B" level="2"> In augury: perpetua fulmina, <hi rend="ital">perpetual lighlnings</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">whose prognostics refer to one's whole life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:47:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 47, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35369.4" n="C" level="2"> In gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuus modus,</quote> <trans><tr>the infinitive mood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 331</bibl></cit> P. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in three forms, perpetuo (class.), perpetuum (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), and perpetue (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n35369.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninterruptedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">always</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hopelessly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuon' valuisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuo ne technae meae perpetuo perierint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dico ut perpetuo pereas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuo perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub imperio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35369.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninterruptedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetually</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:99" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35369.7" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpĕtŭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 62, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpexus: <entryFree id="n35370" type="main" key="perpexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pecto</etym>, <sense id="n35370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wellcombed</hi> (post-class.): barba, Firm. Math. 5, 5.</sense></entryFree>
perpinguis: <entryFree id="n35371" type="main" key="perpinguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pinguis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very rich</hi> (postclass.): harenae, Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 45 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
perplaceo: <entryFree id="n35372" type="main" key="perpla^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-plăcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to please greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid placeant, me rogas? immo hercle vero perplacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi mei perplacet mihi consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perplacet (as affirm. answer),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 22</bibl></cit> (Fleck. satis placet): <cit><quote lang="la">ea (lex) mihi perplacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 23, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perplanus: <entryFree id="n35373" type="main" key="perpla_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-plānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very plain</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">expositio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 431</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
perplexabilis: <entryFree id="n35374" type="main" key="perplexa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perplexābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perplexor</etym>, <sense id="n35374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perplexing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <trans><tr>obscure</tr>, <tr>ambiguous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod aliud audiatur, aliud sentiatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 151, 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perplexābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a perplexing manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perplexabiliter earum hodie perpavefaciam pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perplexe: <entryFree id="n35375" type="main" key="perplexe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perplexē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perplexus <sense id="n35375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perplexim: <entryFree id="n35376" type="main" key="perplexim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perplexim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>perplexus</etym>, <sense id="n35376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intricately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum ego perplexim lacessam oratione ad hunc modum, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit> (76 Ritschl); Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 515, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perplexio: <entryFree id="n35377" type="main" key="perplexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perplexĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perplexity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguity;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, Porc. Latro, Decl. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perplexitas: <entryFree id="n35378" type="main" key="perplexi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perplexĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perplexity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscurity</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perplexor: <entryFree id="n35379" type="main" key="perplexor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perplexor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype> (old <sense id="n35379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> perplexarier; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make confusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause perplexity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio, quo vos soleatis pacto perplexarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perplexus: <entryFree id="n35380" type="main" key="perplexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-plexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plecto</etym>, <sense id="n35380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">entangled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">involved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n35380.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 102</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 459</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:463" default="NO" valid="yes">463</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramina linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora terraï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 391</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 2, 1, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 40, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35380.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">intricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">involved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unintelligible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inscrutable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perplexius carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perplexum Punico astu responsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intricacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorare se dixit, quidnam perplexi sua legatio haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 57</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio perplexior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 15, 13, § 62</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perplexē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscurely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergin', scelesta, mecum perplexe loqui?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defectionem haud perplexe indicavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perplexius errare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 847</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35380.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with minute care</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perplicatus: <entryFree id="n35381" type="hapax" key="perpli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-plĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [plico], <sense id="n35381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">interlaced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangled.</hi>—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">perque plicatis (elementis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 394</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perploro: <entryFree id="n35382" type="gloss" key="perplo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-plōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weep greatly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 928, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpluo: <entryFree id="n35383" type="main" key="perplu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-plŭo</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">perplouo</orth>, Fest. s. v. patera, p. 250 Müll.; <sense id="n35383.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35383.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35383.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rain through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rain in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā possit ex imbribus aqua perpluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circuire oportet, sicubi perpluat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 155</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35383.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To let the rain through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admit the rain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit imber, perpluunt tigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cenaculum perplueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: pateram perplouere in sacris cum dicitur significat,<cb n="PERP" />  pertusam esse, Fest. s. v. patera, p. 250 Müll.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">benefacta benefactis aliis pertegito, ne perpluant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fall to ruin</tr>, <tr>lose their value</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit> (320 Ritschl).—</sense><sense id="n35383.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35383.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rain</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas, quam mihi amor in pectus perpluit meum,</quote> <trans><tr>has rained into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n35383.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sprinkle profusely</hi> with something: <cit><quote lang="la">crocus capellas odore perpluit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 255, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpolio: <entryFree id="n35384" type="main" key="perpo^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum</itype> (<sense id="n35384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> perpolibo, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, 28</bibl>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to polish well.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35384.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco calce arenāque perpolito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:22:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum tritu perpolitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudae setas horridas comptā diligentiā perpolibo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, 28, p. 185</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:22:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 22, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35384.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to polish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put the finishing hand to</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpolire et absolvere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpolire atque conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpoliendi labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae habes instituta, perpolies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpŏlītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">thoroughly polished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refined</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines perfecti in dicendo et perpoliti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non sit omnibus iis artibus perpolitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">litteris perpolitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita perpolita humanitate (opp. immanis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 42, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 120</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpŏlītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a very polished manner;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfecte et perpolitissime absolutae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpolitio: <entryFree id="n35385" type="main" key="perpo^li_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpŏlītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perpolio</etym>, <sense id="n35385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thorough polishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elaborating</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 13, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpolitus: <entryFree id="n35386" type="main" key="perpo^li_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpŏlītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from perpolio.</entryFree>
perpopulor: <entryFree id="n35387" type="main" key="perpo^pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pŏpŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n35387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay quite waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastate; to plunder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pillage completely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum Placentinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 26</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>, in a pass. signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">perpopulato agro,</quote> <trans><tr>completely laid waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perporto: <entryFree id="n35388" type="main" key="perporto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-porto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">transport</hi> a thing to a place: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam Carthaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
perpotatio: <entryFree id="n35389" type="main" key="perpo_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpōtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perpoto</etym>, <sense id="n35389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a continued drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drinking-bout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduo duabusque noctibus perpotationem continuare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemperantissimae perpotationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomitiones ac rursus perpotationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpotior: <entryFree id="n35390" type="main" key="perpo^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pŏtĭor</orth>, <itype>īri</itype>, <sense id="n35390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get entire possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoy completely</hi> (jurid. Lat.).—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">privilegiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine tribunorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpoto: <entryFree id="n35391" type="main" key="perpo_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pōto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n35391.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tipple without intermission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep up a carouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ejus hinc pater sit profectus peregre, tum perpotasse adsiduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 38</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">100: perpotavit ad vesperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpotandi dulcedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n35391.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drink off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amarum Absinthi laticem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:940" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 940</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpremo: <entryFree id="n35392" type="main" key="perpre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perprĕmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. perprimo, I.</entryFree>
perpressa: <entryFree id="n35393" type="main" key="perpressa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perpressa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n35393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> bacchar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 77, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:87" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 55, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perprimo: <entryFree id="n35394" type="main" key="perpri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-prĭmo</orth>, <itype>pressi, pressum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n35394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to press perpetually</hi> (Aug.). </sense><sense id="n35394.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia,</quote> <trans><tr>to lie upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:38" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem perprimit (al. perpremit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35394.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 394</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perprobabilis: <entryFree id="n35395" type="main" key="perpro^ba_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-prŏbābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very worthy of belief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">highly probable</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Music. 1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Music. 1, 6, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpropere: <entryFree id="n35396" type="spur" key="perpro^pe^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-prŏpĕre</orth>, a false read. for praepropere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 10</bibl>.</entryFree>
perpropinquus: <entryFree id="n35397" type="main" key="perpro^pinquus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-prŏpinquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very near</hi>: commutatio rerum, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 45</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 36 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
perprosper: <entryFree id="n35398" type="main" key="perprosper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-prosper</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very prosperous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo,</quote> <trans><tr>very good</tr>, <tr>excellent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perprurisco: <entryFree id="n35399" type="main" key="perpru_risco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-prūrisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n35399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to itch all over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi perpruriscamus usque ex unguiculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 209, 12</bibl>. <cb n="PERR" /></sense></entryFree>
perpudesco: <entryFree id="n35400" type="main" key="perpu^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pŭdesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to feel great shame</hi>, Cornelia ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Fragm. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Fragm. 12, 2</bibl> Staver.</sense></entryFree>
perpugnax: <entryFree id="n35401" type="main" key="perpugnax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pugnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very pugnacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpugnax in disputando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 93</bibl></cit>; Aug. contr. Acad. 3, 4.</sense></entryFree>
perpulcher: <entryFree id="n35402" type="main" key="perpulcher"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pulcher</orth>, <itype>chra, chrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very beautiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpulsus: <entryFree id="n35403" type="main" key="perpulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pello</etym>, <sense id="n35403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatly smitten</hi>: me malis perpulsum, Front. Ep. ad Verum, 9 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
perpungo: <entryFree id="n35404" type="main" key="perpungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pungo</orth>, <itype>punxi, punctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pierce through and through</hi> (post-class. and only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10:71" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perpurgo: <entryFree id="n35405" type="main" key="perpurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-purgo</orth> (ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">perpūrĭgo</orth>, v. Ritschl, Opusc. 2, 426 sqq.), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purge thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make quite clean.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35405.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpurgata ulcera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26</bibl></cit>, n. 36: <cit><quote lang="la">perpurigatis auribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with the greatest attention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35405.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to clear up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus orationis perpurgatus ab iis, qui ante me dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 26, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 8, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 2</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de dote tanto magis perpurga,</quote> <trans><tr>settle</tr>, <tr>arrange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perpurigatus: <entryFree id="n35406" type="main" key="perpu_ri^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pūrĭgātus</orth>, v. perpurgo.</entryFree>
perpurus: <entryFree id="n35407" type="hapax" key="perpu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very clean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 28</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. purpurea).</sense></entryFree>
perpusillus: <entryFree id="n35408" type="hapax" key="perpu^sillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pŭsillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very little</hi>: pusillus testis processit ... Non accusabis: perpusillum rogabo, in a double sense (<pos>adj.</pos> or <pos>adv.</pos>), <hi rend="ital">I will ask very little</hi>, or, <hi rend="ital">the very little man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 245</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perputo: <entryFree id="n35409" type="main" key="perpu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-pŭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to trim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prune thoroughly.</hi>—Hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">to set forth plainly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">neatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum alicui, ut ego argumentum hoc vobis plane perputem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perquadratus: <entryFree id="n35410" type="main" key="perquadra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-quadrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perfectly square</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5</bibl>, praef. 4 Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
perquam: <entryFree id="n35411" type="main" key="perquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-quam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (also, less correctly, written separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">per quam</orth>, v. per <sense id="n35411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">as much as possible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illorum mores perquam meditate tenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquam indignis modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquam breviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 49, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquam modica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:60" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquam velim scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes perquam infelicissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 953, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 6</bibl></cit>. —In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">per pol quam paucos reperias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perquiesco: <entryFree id="n35412" type="main" key="perqui^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-quĭesco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n35412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rest all through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spend in rest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam noctem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perquiritatus: <entryFree id="n35413" type="main" key="perqui_ri^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perquīrĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><pos>P. a.</pos> of unused perquirito, āre</etym>, <sense id="n35413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatly sought after</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opusculum usquequaque perquiritatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
perquiro: <entryFree id="n35414" type="main" key="perqui_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-quīro</orth>, <itype>sīvi, sītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quaero</etym>. <sense id="n35414.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To ask</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquire after diligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make diligent search for</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">perquirunt, quid causae siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 58</bibl>, § 134; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 22, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a contemplandis rebus perquirendisque deterreri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus viasque in Suevos perquirit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 8, 8, § 23</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquirite et videte si, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>make inquiry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 10, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquiritur a coactoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35414.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To examine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitionem rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:29:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 29, 112</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perquīsītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquisitius conscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:41:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 41, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perquisitor: <entryFree id="n35415" type="main" key="perqui_si_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perquīsītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perquiro</etym>, <sense id="n35415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeker out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hunter after</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">auctionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perquisitus: <entryFree id="n35416" type="main" key="perqui_si_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perquīsītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perquiro.</entryFree>
perraro: <entryFree id="n35417" type="main" key="perra_ro_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perrārō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perrarus.</entryFree>
perrarus: <entryFree id="n35418" type="main" key="perra_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-rārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very uncommon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very rare</hi> (as an <pos>adj.</pos> not in Cic.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 38, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perrarum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perrārō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very seldom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very rarely</hi>: si quando id efficit, quod perraro potest. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 40, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perraro haec alea fallit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perreconditus: <entryFree id="n35419" type="main" key="perre^condi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-rĕcondĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very hidden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abstruse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very recondite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio consuetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:30:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 30, 135</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1353" /> <cb n="PERS" /></sense></entryFree>
perrectus: <entryFree id="n35420" type="main" key="perrectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perrectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pergo.</entryFree>
perrepo: <entryFree id="n35421" type="main" key="perre_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-rēpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n35421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35421.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to creep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crawl through</hi> to a place: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praesepia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliena jugorum compluvia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35421.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crawl through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem genibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:85" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perrepto: <entryFree id="n35422" type="main" key="perrepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perrepto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>perrepo</etym>, <sense id="n35422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to creep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crawl through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes plateas perreptavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">omnes latebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perreptavi usque omne oppidum ad portam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perrhaebi: <entryFree id="n35423" type="main" key="Perrhaebi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Perrhaebi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perraiboi/</foreign>, <sense id="n35423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Thessaly about Tempe and Mount Olympus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Perrhœbians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 53</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35423.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Perrhaebus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Perrhœbian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pindus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 4), 33, 55: <cit><quote lang="la">Caeneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 172</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35423.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Perrhaebĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perraibi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Perrhœbians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Perrhœbia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 41, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perridicule: <entryFree id="n35424" type="main" key="perri_di^cu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perrīdĭcŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perridiculus <sense id="n35424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perridiculus: <entryFree id="n35425" type="main" key="perri_di^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-rīdĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very laughable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very ridiculous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perrī-dĭcŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very laughably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very ridiculously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 239</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perridicule homines augurabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 18</bibl></cit> Zumpt, <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perrimosus: <entryFree id="n35426" type="spur" key="perri_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-rīmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, a false read. for paeminosus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:51:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 51, 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
perrodo: <entryFree id="n35427" type="main" key="perro_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-rōdo</orth>, <itype>rōsi, rōsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gnaw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eat through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non plures sinus perroserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 16, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perrogatio: <entryFree id="n35428" type="main" key="perro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perrŏgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perrogo</etym>, <sense id="n35428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Ver. 288, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35428.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The passage of a law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perrogationem legis Maniliae flagitasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perrogito: <entryFree id="n35429" type="hapax" key="perro^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-rŏgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ask through in succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ask one after another</hi>: defessus perrogitando advenas de gnatis, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 634</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. v. 315 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
perrogo: <entryFree id="n35430" type="main" key="perro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-rŏgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35430.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To ask through in succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ask one after another</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35430.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to carry through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi> (a law) after proposing it: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus plebis legem perrogavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:6:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:2" default="NO">1, 2</bibl> ext. 1.</sense></entryFree>
perrumpo: <entryFree id="n35431" type="main" key="perrumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-rumpo</orth>, <itype>rūpi, ruptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n35431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break through.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35431.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rush through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to force one's way through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per medios hostes perrumpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vestibulum templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in triclinium usque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec per castra eorum perrumpi ad Capuam posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35431.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35431.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to break through</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rates perrumperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perrumpitur concretus aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipenni Limina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum cratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">costam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35431.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to force one's way through</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acie perruptā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perruptus hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheronta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35431.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 32, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perrumpi affectu aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus, qui te invito perrumpunt,</quote> <trans><tr>overcome your modesty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perruptus: <entryFree id="n35432" type="main" key="perruptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perrumpo.</entryFree>
persa: <entryFree id="n35433" type="main" key="Persa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Persae.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35434" type="main" key="Persa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pe/rsh</foreign>, <sense id="n35434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Oceanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of Circe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Perses</hi> (the father of Hecate), <hi rend="ital">Æetes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Pasiphăe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the Sungod</hi>, Hyg. Fab. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Perseis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 48</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35434.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Per-sēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Persa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Persean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perseia Hecate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:495" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Æetes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:582" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 582</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35434.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Persēĭs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the female descendant of Persa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hecate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:481" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 481</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perseides herbae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>magic herbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 263</bibl></cit>.—Perseis (sc. Musa), <hi rend="ital">the title of a Latin poem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35435" type="main" key="Persa3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a little dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persae: <entryFree id="n35436" type="main" key="Persae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pe/rsai</foreign>, <sense id="n35436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Persians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originally the inhabitants of the country of Persis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards of the great kingdom<cb n="PERS" />  of Persia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 10, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 11, 48</bibl> et saep.—In <number>sing.</number> in the Gr. form: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Perses</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (ante- and post-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Persa</orth>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 13, 65</bibl>.—Form Persa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3</bibl> epil.; Ven. Fort. Carm. 5, 6, 208. —Also, <hi rend="ital">the name of a comedy by Plautus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Persian.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n35436.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35436.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Persia</hi>: in Persas est profectus, <hi rend="ital">to the Persians</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to Persia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n35436.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Parthians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35436.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Persis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of Persis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Caramania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Media</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Susiana</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fars</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Farsistan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:5" default="NO">3, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 4</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 290</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 258</bibl>. —In the Lat. form: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Persia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35436.5" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Persian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 172</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a Persian woman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35436.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Persian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Persic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 16, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 26, 29, § 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 26, 29, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:328" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <trans><tr>in the Eubœan Sea</tr>, <tr>where the Persian fleet was stationed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 248</bibl></cit> and 256; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=217" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 217</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Persica malus,</quote> <trans><tr>a peach-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Persica arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 17, § 60</bibl></cit>: Persici apparatus, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luxurious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Per-sĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a peach-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:3" default="NO">9, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35436.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭ-cum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a peach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 11, 12, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:46" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35436.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (Gr <foreign lang="greek">*persikh/</foreign>): porticus, lit. <hi rend="ital">a portico in Lacedœmon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built out of spoils taken from the Persians;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a gallery in Brutus's country-seat</hi>, named after it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 9, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35436.9" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Per-sĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Persian history</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Dionis Persicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Persian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persaepe: <entryFree id="n35437" type="main" key="persaepe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-saepe</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very frequently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod persaepe fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons, oculi, voltus persaepe mentiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persaepe velut qui Junonis sacra ferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 349</bibl>.—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">per pol saepe peccas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persaepolis: <entryFree id="n35438" type="main" key="Persaepo^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persaepŏlis</orth>, v. Persepolis.</entryFree>
persaevio: <entryFree id="n35439" type="main" key="persaevi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-saevĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be furious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctibus hanc propter persaevit Caspius aestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 683</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persaevus: <entryFree id="n35440" type="main" key="persaevus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-saevus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very furious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persagadae: <entryFree id="n35441" type="main" key="Persaga^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persagădae</orth>, v. Pasargadae.</entryFree>
persalse: <entryFree id="n35442" type="main" key="persalse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persalsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. persalsus <sense id="n35442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
persalsus: <entryFree id="n35443" type="main" key="persalsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-salsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very witty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 279</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-salsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very wittily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratias agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persalutatio: <entryFree id="n35444" type="hapax" key="persa^lu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persălūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>persaluto</etym>, <sense id="n35444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saluting of all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assiduous salutation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
