persaluto: <entryFree id="n35445" type="main" key="persa^lu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sălūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to salute one after another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomenculatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persancte: <entryFree id="n35446" type="main" key="persancte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persanctē</orth>, v. persanctus.</entryFree>
persanctus: <entryFree id="n35447" type="main" key="persanctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sanctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sacred</hi> or <hi rend="ital">holy</hi>: CONIVX, Inscr. Afr. ap. Rénier, 4414.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sanctē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very sacredly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">religiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejerare,</quote> <trans><tr>to swear solemnly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persano: <entryFree id="n35448" type="main" key="persa_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sāno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cure completely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 244</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:188 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 120, § 188 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
persanus: <entryFree id="n35449" type="main" key="persa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perfectly sound</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
persapiens: <entryFree id="n35450" type="main" key="persa^pi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-săpĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very wise</hi>, homo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 44</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">persăpĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very wisely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">persapienter dat ipsa lex potestatem defendendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persceleratus: <entryFree id="n35451" type="gloss" key="persce^le^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scĕlĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very vicious</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persciens: <entryFree id="n35452" type="main" key="persci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [scio], <sense id="n35452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowing well.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum persciens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very knowingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very discreetly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:202" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perscindo: <entryFree id="n35453" type="main" key="perscindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scindo</orth>, <itype>scĭdi, scissum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="PERS" /> <hi rend="ital">rend asunder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:180" default="NO" valid="yes">180</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:63" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia perscindente vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 58, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 111</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 599</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perscisco: <entryFree id="n35454" type="main" key="perscisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to learn thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become well informed of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam tumultūs cupidus persciscere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 2, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perscissus: <entryFree id="n35455" type="main" key="perscissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perscissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perscindo.</entryFree>
perscitus: <entryFree id="n35456" type="main" key="persci_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very clever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very fine.</hi>—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud Catonem est ... per mihi scitum videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ecastor scitus puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perscribo: <entryFree id="n35457" type="main" key="perscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35457.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to write in full</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to write out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to write without abbreviations</hi> (cf.: conscribo, compono): verbo non perscripto, <hi rend="ital">not being written in full</hi>, Tiro Tullius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in M. Catonis quartā Origine ita perscriptum est,</quote> <trans><tr>written out</tr>, <tr>written in full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notata, non perscripta erat summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est circa perscribendas vel paucioribus litteris notandas voces studium necessarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:Not. Sign. 1" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> Not. Sign. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35457.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35457.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To write a full description of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to write in full</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to write out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc velim mihi plane perscribas, quid videas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de meis rebus ad Lollium perscripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc perscriptum in monumentis veteribus reperietis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 88</bibl></cit>: res populi Romani a primordio urbis, Liv. praef. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versum puris verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 54</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35457.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To write</hi> or <hi rend="ital">note down; to enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">register</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam nondum perscriptum est senatūs consultum, ex memoriā vobis, quid senatus censuerit exponam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabulas publicas ad aerarium perscribenda curavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 21, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 35, § 89</bibl>.—Hence, tabulae ubi aera perscribantur usuraria, i. e. <hi rend="ital">inscribed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but never paid out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 53</bibl>.—Esp., of entering in an account-book: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35457.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To write a full account of</hi> to any one, <hi rend="ital">to announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">describe in writing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by letter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem gestam in Eburonibus perscribit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perscribit in litteris hostes ab se discessisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35457.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make over in writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assign</hi> any thing to any one: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum perscripsi illis, quibus debui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 19, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid usurae nomine numeratum aut perscriptum fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35457.6" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To draw a line across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cross</hi> a written character = <foreign lang="greek">diagra/fein</foreign> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">as nummus est libralis et per I perscriptam notatur †: dupondius nummus est bilibris per duas II perscriptas H, etc. ... denarius quoque decem librarum nummus per X perscriptam notatur *,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> de Ponder. p. 1347</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
perscriptio: <entryFree id="n35458" type="main" key="perscripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perscriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perscribo</etym>. <sense id="n35458.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A writing down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an entry</hi> in a book, <hi rend="ital">an official recording</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perscriptionum et liturarum adversaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 250</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsae perscriptiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35458.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A making over in writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an assignment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 51, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec pactio non verbis sed nominibua et perscriptionibus facta est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perscriptito: <entryFree id="n35459" type="main" key="perscripti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scriptĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to write down</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> de Syllab. p. 2391</bibl> P. (al. praescriptitare).</sense></entryFree>
perscriptor: <entryFree id="n35460" type="main" key="perscriptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perscriptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawer up</hi> in writing, <hi rend="ital">a writer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenerationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:72:section=168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 72, § 168</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perscriptura: <entryFree id="n35461" type="main" key="perscriptu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perscriptūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing up</hi> in writing, <hi rend="ital">a writing</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum testamenti faciunt perscripturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (al. cum testamentum faciunt, per scripturam adicere).</sense></entryFree>
perscriptus: <entryFree id="n35462" type="main" key="perscriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perscribo.</entryFree>
perscrutatio: <entryFree id="n35463" type="main" key="perscru_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perscrūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perscrutor</etym>, <sense id="n35463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searching through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an examination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundi perscrutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 9:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 9, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perscrutator: <entryFree id="n35464" type="main" key="perscru_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perscrūtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thorough searcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an examiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigator</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">talium rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 1</bibl></cit> (al. persecutor); <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 3</bibl> (al. prosecutores); <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perscrutatrix: <entryFree id="n35465" type="main" key="perscru_ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perscrūtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perscrutator</etym>, <pb n="1354" /> <cb n="PERS" /> <sense id="n35465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an examiner</hi> (late Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 2, 103.</sense></entryFree>
perscruto: <entryFree id="n35466" type="main" key="perscru_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scrūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. perscrutor <sense id="n35466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perscrutor: <entryFree id="n35467" type="main" key="perscru_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-scrūtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n35467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to search through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n35467.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculari et perscrutari aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes, qui investigabant et perscrutabantur omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arculas muliebres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35467.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to examine into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam scriptoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:44:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 44, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam rationemque criminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 8, 19</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n35467.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">perscrū-to</orth>, āre: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc perscrutavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35467.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">perscrūtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in pass. signif., <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persculptus: <entryFree id="n35468" type="main" key="persculptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sculptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [sculpo], <sense id="n35468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engraved</hi>: lapides, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:377" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 377</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persea: <entryFree id="n35469" type="greek" key="perse^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perse/a</foreign>, <sense id="n35469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacred tree in Egypt and Persia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 15, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 13, 13, § 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perseco: <entryFree id="n35470" type="main" key="perse^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĕco</orth>, <itype>cui, ctum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exlirpate; to cut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excise;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: rei publicae vomicas, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum naturas,</quote> <trans><tr>to dissect</tr>, <tr>lay bare the secrets of nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 122</bibl></cit>. (For perseca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, read persece; v. persequor, I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>）</sense></entryFree>
persector: <entryFree id="n35471" type="main" key="persector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persector</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n35471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [persequor], <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursue eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to investigate</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">persectari hoc volo, Sceledre, nos nostri an alieni simus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1010" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1010</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec persectari primordia singula quaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persecutio: <entryFree id="n35472" type="main" key="perse^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕcūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a following after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursuing; a chase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursuit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35472.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 155, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluviis persecutionem passi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 16, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35472.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35472.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A prosecution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 41, 141</bibl> (dub.; al. praescriptionum); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:4:18:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 4, 18, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35472.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A persecution</hi>, esp. of Christians, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">De Fuga in Persecutione,</quote> <trans><tr>the title of a treatise by Tertullian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n35472.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A following up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosecution</hi> of an affair: <cit><quote lang="la">negotii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 252, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persecutor: <entryFree id="n35473" type="main" key="perse^cu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕcūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n35473.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pursuer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiorum turpium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Alb. 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35473.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A persecutor</hi> of Christians, Mort. Persec. 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inst. 5, 23, 1</bibl>: Ecclesiae, Hieron. Ep. ad Helv. 3: sub ense persecutoris pati, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35473.2" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A prosecutor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plaintiff</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persecutoria: <entryFree id="n35474" type="main" key="perse^cu_to_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕcūtōrĭa</orth>, v. prosecutoria.</entryFree>
persecutrix: <entryFree id="n35475" type="main" key="perse^cu_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕcūtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>persecutor</etym>, <sense id="n35475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that pursues</hi> or <hi rend="ital">persecutes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Cons. Evang. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Cons. Evang. 1, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persecutus: <entryFree id="n35476" type="main" key="perse^cu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕcūtus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕquūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from persequor.</entryFree>
persedeo: <entryFree id="n35477" type="main" key="perse^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĕdĕo</orth>, <itype>sēdi, sessum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remain sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stay long</hi> anywhere (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">at neque quo pacto persederit umor aquai Visumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā nocte in speculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in equo dies noctesque persedendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui multis apud philosophum annis persederint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam meridie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35477.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of frost: <cit><quote lang="la">pruinae perniciosior natura, quoniam lapsa persidet gelatque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 222</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persegnis: <entryFree id="n35478" type="main" key="persegnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-segnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sluggish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perseis: <entryFree id="n35479" type="main" key="Perse_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 2. Persa, B.</entryFree>
perseius: <entryFree id="n35480" type="main" key="Perse_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Persa, A., and 1. Perseus, B. 2.</entryFree>
persenesco: <entryFree id="n35481" type="main" key="perse^nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĕnesco</orth>, <itype>nŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow old</hi> anywhere (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ibi persenuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persenex: <entryFree id="n35482" type="main" key="perse^nex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĕnex</orth>, <itype>sĕnis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very old</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persenilis: <entryFree id="n35483" type="main" key="perse^ni_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĕnīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very old</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aged</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 23, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persentio: <entryFree id="n35484" type="main" key="persenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sentĭo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to perceive plainly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35484.1" n="I" level="1"> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 193, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35484.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To feel deeply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectore curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 448</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persentisco: <entryFree id="n35485" type="main" key="persentisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sentisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n35485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35485.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To perceive clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to detect</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ne legio persentiscat, clam illuc redeundum'st mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi possem persentiscere, Ni essem lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35485.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To feel deeply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera persentiscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (249). <cb n="PERS" /></sense></entryFree>
persephone: <entryFree id="n35486" type="main" key="Perse^pho^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĕphŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*persefo/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n35486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Proserpine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:591" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 591</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:276" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 276</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:47 sq" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28, 47 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4849</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35486.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at mihi Persephone nigram denunciat horam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persephonium: <entryFree id="n35487" type="greek" key="perse^pho^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕphŏnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">persefo/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n35487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild poppy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persepolis: <entryFree id="n35488" type="main" key="Perse_po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persēpŏlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Persaep-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*persaipolis</foreign>, <sense id="n35488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Persia</hi>, the ruins of which are now called <hi rend="ital">Istakhr</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 29, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:11" default="NO">5, 6, 11</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persequax: <entryFree id="n35489" type="main" key="perse^quax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĕquax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eagerly pursuing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in reatu pervestigando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 9</bibl></cit> (but in App. Flor. n. 23, p. 366, 5, or de Deo Soc. prol. p. 108, Hild. reads oculis perspicax).</sense></entryFree>
persequens: <entryFree id="n35490" type="main" key="perse^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from persequor.</entryFree>
persequor: <entryFree id="n35491" type="main" key="perse^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĕquor</orth>, <itype>cūtus and quūtus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form of the <hi rend="ital">imperat.</hi> persece for perseque, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>). </sense><sense id="n35491.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow perseveringly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35491.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35491.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille servolum Jubet illum persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vis persequi vestigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me in Asiam persequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(persequens dicit perseverationem sequentis ostendens. Persequitur enim qui non desinit sequi, Don. ad h. l.): aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensium ipsius vestigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:307" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā, aut terrā aut mari, persequar eum, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 218</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc persecuta mater orare incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 28, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">atqui non ego te tigris ut aspera ... frangere persequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35491.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35491.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientes usque ad flumen persequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterrere hostes a persequendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beluas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35491.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To go through</hi> a place in pursuit of any thing, <hi rend="ital">to search through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes solitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 53</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35491.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to follow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come up with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overtake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ego te ne persequi quidem possem triginta diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors et fugacem persequitur virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35491.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35491.9" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to follow perseveringly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes vias persequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35491.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35491.11" n="a" level="4"> With the accessory notion of striving after, <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hunt after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive after</hi>, = appetere, affectare: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est, qui utilia non studiosissime persequatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:28:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 28, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego mihi alios deos penates persequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pl.</hi> Tene priusquam hinc abeo savium. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Si quidem mi hercle regnum detur, numquam id potius persequar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditates aut syngraphas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusquemodi voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: ego meum jus persequar, <hi rend="ital">I will pursue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assert my right</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">persequendi juris sui potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona tua repetere ac persequi lite atque judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:13:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 13, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possumus rem nostram persequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 13, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tribunus plebis poenas a seditioso cive per bonos viros judicio persequi vellet,</quote> <trans><tr>sought to obtain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35491.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be eager</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nec scimus quam in partem ingredi persequamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35491.13" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be a follower of; to imitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copy after</hi> a person or thing as a guide or pattern: <cit><quote lang="la">si vero Academiam veterem persequamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectam et instituta alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego neglectā barbarorum inscitiā te persequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quae maxime excellant in eo, quem imitabitur, ea diligentissime persequatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35491.14" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosecute; to revenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take vengeance upon</hi> a person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem judicio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus injurias ulcisci ac persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 23</bibl>; cf. Kritz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9</bibl>, <cb n="PERS" /> 5: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de persequendis inimicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 83 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebonii mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:18:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 18, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35491.15" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To persecute</hi> for religious belief or practice (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Scap. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 15, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 7, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 12, 14</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n35491.16" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi> in writing, <hi rend="ital">to take down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minute down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritate scribendi, quae dicerentur persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa diserte dixit, quae notarius persequi non potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35491.17" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow up</hi> with action, <hi rend="ital">to follow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc, ut dico, factis persequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erus quod imperavit persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:84 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 84 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex usu quod est, id persequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si idem extrema persequitur qui inchoavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam inopem et vagam,</quote> <trans><tr>to lead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen ibo et persequar,</quote> <trans><tr>will go and obey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 64</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35491.18" n="(b)" level="5"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to follow out</hi> in speech or writing, <hi rend="ital">to set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum rationes Persequor,</quote> <trans><tr>set forth</tr>, <tr>treat of</tr>, <tr>discuss the reasons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae versibus persecutus est Ennius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam Latinis litteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid scripturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscenas voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Hannibalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has res in eo libro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae persequerer, si commemorare possem sine dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: da te in sermonem et persece Et confice, etc., Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 23, 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n35491.19" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come after</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exacta vindemia gramine persecuto,</quote> <trans><tr>when the grass has grown again</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 26, 5</bibl></cit>.!*? In a pass. signif. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illa se in mare praecipitavit, ne persequeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 198" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 198</bibl></cit> dub.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, used as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n35491.20" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pursuer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practiser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n35491.21" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A revenger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avenger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitiarum persequentissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persero: <entryFree id="n35492" type="main" key="perse^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sēvi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod (semen) non persevit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 386</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35493" type="main" key="perse^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĕro</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run through</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">resticulas per ficos maturas perserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perserpo: <entryFree id="n35494" type="main" key="perserpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-serpo</orth>, <itype>serpsi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to creep perpetually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crawl</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 100, 31</bibl> Keil.</sense></entryFree>
perservio: <entryFree id="n35495" type="hapax" key="perservi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-servĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n35495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve throughout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 18</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
perservo: <entryFree id="n35496" type="main" key="perservo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-servo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to preserve</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">patientiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pat. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perses: <entryFree id="n35497" type="main" key="Perses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Perses</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pe/rshs</foreign>. <sense id="n35497.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Persian;</hi> v. Persae.—</sense><sense id="n35497.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Perseus and Andromeda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the progenitor of the Persians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 201</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35497.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Sol and Persa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Æetes and Circe</hi>, Hyg. Fab. praef.—</sense><sense id="n35497.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The last king of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was conquered by Æmilius Paulus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 19, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 40, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 39. Called also, after the Gr. form, Perseus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:57 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 57 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 23</bibl> sq.; 44, 32 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 676</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Persi, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 52</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> Persi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 25, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n35497.4" n="B" level="2"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to King Perses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Persean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 28, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perseus: <entryFree id="n35498" type="main" key="Perseus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Perseus</orth>, <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype> (<case>acc.</case>, Persea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 610</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perseu/s</foreign>. <sense id="n35498.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Jupiter and Danăē</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandoned by his grandfather Acrisius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but rescued and brought up by Polydectes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Seriphus. When grown up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he undertook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the instigation of Polydectes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an expedition against the islands of the Gorgons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and received from Vulcan a sickle-shaped sword</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from Mercury winged shoes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and from Minerva a shield and the flying horse Pegasus. Thus armed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he killed and cut off the head of Medusa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose look turned every thing into stone. On his way back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by means of it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turned into stone a sea-monster to which Andromeda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Cepheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was exposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and married her. Their son Perses became the progenitor of the Persians. After his death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Perseus was placed among</hi> <pb n="1355" /> <cb n="PERS" /> <hi rend="ital">the constellations</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:609 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 609 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 64" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:244" default="NO">244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astron. 12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astron. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30</bibl> (3, 28), 4; 2, 28 (3, 24), 22; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 246</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35498.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n35498.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Per-sēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Perseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Persean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">Perseos alter in Argos scinditur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where Perseus's grandfather</tr>, <tr>Acrisius</tr>, <tr>reigned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:255" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persei culmina montis,</quote> <trans><tr>the mountain where Perseus first mounted Pegasus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persea Tarsos,</quote> <trans><tr>founded by Perseus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Babylon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 449</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35498.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Per-sēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Persean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perseia castra sequi,</quote> <trans><tr>to fight in his army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35498.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The last king of Macedonia</hi>, v. Perses, IV.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35499" type="main" key="Perse_us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n35499.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art., I. B. 1.</sense></entryFree>
perseverabilis: <entryFree id="n35500" type="main" key="perse^ve_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕvērābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>persevero</etym>, <sense id="n35500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">persevering</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tenacitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:198" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perseverans: <entryFree id="n35501" type="main" key="perse^ve_rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕvērans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from persevero.</entryFree>
perseveranter: <entryFree id="n35502" type="main" key="perse^ve_ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕvēranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. persevero, <sense id="n35502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perseverantia: <entryFree id="n35503" type="main" key="perse^ve_ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕvērantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>persevero</etym>, <sense id="n35503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">steadfastness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perseverance</hi> (syn. pertinacia): <cit><quote lang="la">perseverantia est in ratione bene consideratā stabilis et perpetua permansio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputandum est, aliud an idem sit pertinacia et perseverantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:19:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 19, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 14, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35503.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, objectively, <hi rend="ital">long continuance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tediousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perseveratio: <entryFree id="n35504" type="main" key="perse^ve_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕvērātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">continuance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duration</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trismeg. p. 101 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:page=178" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> p. 178</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
persevere: <entryFree id="n35505" type="main" key="perse^ve_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕvērē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perseverus <sense id="n35505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
persevero: <entryFree id="n35506" type="main" key="perse^ve_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕvēro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n35506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [perseverus]. </sense><sense id="n35506.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abide by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adhere to strictly; to continue steadfastly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to persist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persevere</hi> in any thing (class.; syn.: persisto, permaneo). </sense><sense id="n35506.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseveras tu quidem et in tuā vetere sententiā permanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in suā sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in errore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo perseveravit, jus publicano non dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiscum,</quote> <trans><tr>continuing with us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 27, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35506.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseveratum in irā est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:39:section=85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 39, § 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo perseverandum putabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35506.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceed with steadily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to persist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persevere</hi> in any thing (class.); usually constr with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause;</hi> rarely with <case>acc.</case> or <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n35506.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 8, 31</bibl></cit>: aliquem conservare, Curius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 29, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Orestes perseveraret, se esse Orestem,</quote> <trans><tr>stuck to it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum id facturos se perseverarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:92:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 92, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35506.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque te ipsum id perseverare et transigere potuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiosam observantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:90" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 90</bibl></cit> (96).—In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob haec illi quatriduo perseverata inedia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 6, 15</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n35506.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellis continuis perseverare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕvērans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">persevering;</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseverantior caedendis (hostibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 31, 4</bibl></cit> (Madv. caedendi).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseverantissimus sui cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: perseverantissimum studium, Col. praef. 1, § 19: pertinaciter perseverans, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Obseq.</author> 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseverantissima pietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 555" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 555</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕvēranter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">perseveringly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseverantius saevire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem perseverantissime diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 21, 3</bibl></cit> (dub.; Keil, persevera).</sense></entryFree>
perseverus: <entryFree id="n35507" type="main" key="perse^ve_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĕvērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very strict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">persĕ-vērē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very strictly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquirere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persia: <entryFree id="n35508" type="main" key="Persi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Persae, II. A.</entryFree>
persianae: <entryFree id="n35509" type="main" key="Persi^a_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭānae Ăquae</orth>, v. Persius, III.</entryFree>
persianus: <entryFree id="n35510" type="main" key="Persi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Persius, B.</entryFree>
persibus: <entryFree id="n35511" type="main" key="persi^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĭbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sibus, callidus sive acutus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n35511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very acute</hi>, Plaut. and Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=217" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 217</bibl> Müll.; cf. Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 107</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
persica: <entryFree id="n35512" type="main" key="Persi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> v. Persae, II. B. 3. <cb n="PERS" /></entryFree>
persiccatus: <entryFree id="n35513" type="main" key="persicca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-siccātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quite dried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectly dry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persiccus: <entryFree id="n35514" type="main" key="persiccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-siccus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very dry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: tempus, Fest. s. v. substillum, pp. 306 and 307 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
persice: <entryFree id="n35515" type="main" key="Persi^ce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Persae, II. B. <sense id="n35515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n35516" type="main" key="Persi^ce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Persae, II. B. 2.</entryFree>
persicus: <entryFree id="n35517" type="main" key="Persi^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Persĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Persae, II. B., and Perses, IV. B.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n35518" type="spur" key="persi^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persĭcus</orth>, corrupted for persibus.</entryFree>
persideo: <entryFree id="n35519" type="main" key="persi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>sēdi, sessum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>per-sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n35519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to continue sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain long sitting</hi> anywhere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 36, § 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persido: <entryFree id="n35520" type="main" key="persi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sīdo</orth>, <itype>sēdi, sessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">settle down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to penetrate</hi> anywhere (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pestilitas fruges persidit in ipsas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:307" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 307</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi frigidus imber Altius ad vivum persedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 442</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persigno: <entryFree id="n35521" type="main" key="persigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-signo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (extremely rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.). <sense id="n35521.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To note down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">record</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uni dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35521.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To mark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notis corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:20" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 20</bibl></cit>; so Firm. Math. 3, 7, 12.</sense></entryFree>
persilio: <entryFree id="n35522" type="gloss" key="persi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>2. salio</etym>, <sense id="n35522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to leap through</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persimilis: <entryFree id="n35523" type="main" key="persi^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sĭmĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very like</hi> or <hi rend="ital">similar</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam istius persimilem deturbant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 38, 93</bibl></cit>: isti tabulae fore librum Persimilem, cujus, etc., Hor A. P 6 sq.</sense></entryFree>
